Poisoned Strike.name: Poisoned Strike
Poisoned Strike.flavor: You splash a few drops of poison on your weapon from a vial at your belt, and slash at your foe. The pain can bring your target to its knees.
Poisoned Strike.onHit:
1[W] damage plus 5 poison damage. Until the end of your next turn, if the target willingly moves more than 2 squares or makes an attack, it then falls prone, and it is immobilized until the end of its next turn.
Level 11: 2[W] plus 5 poison damage.
Level 21: 3[W] plus 5 poison damage.

Concealed Weapon.name: Concealed Weapon
Concealed Weapon.flavor: You have learned how to keep a weapon completely hidden from searching eyes.
Concealed Weapon.effect: The target weapon is invisible until the end of the encounter or until you attack with it. The first target you attack with a weapon affected by this power grants you combat advantage for that attack.

Fever Poison.name: Fever Poison
Fever Poison.flavor: You draw a hidden vial and sprinkle its contents on your weapon in one swift motion before attacking. This poison dazes and disorients your foe.
Fever Poison.onHit: As above, but 4[W] damage plus 5 poison damage.

Draining Poison.name: Draining Poison
Draining Poison.flavor: A splash from a tiny vial coats your weapon with a lethal venom that cripples the target with cramping muscles.
Draining Poison.onHit: As above, but 2[W] damage plus 10 poison damage, and ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends).

Envenomed Weapon.name: Envenomed Weapon
Envenomed Weapon.flavor: You smear prepared poison on your weapon to erode your enemy’s stamina.
Envenomed Weapon.effect: The next creature hit by a melee attack using this weapon before the end of the encounter gains vulnerable 5 poison until the end of your next turn.

Crystal Spider Poison.name: Crystal Spider Poison
Crystal Spider Poison.flavor: You splash a few drops of a debilitating poison on your blade before striking, briefly weakening your foe.
Crystal Spider Poison.onHit: As above, but 4[W] damage plus 5 poison damage.

Insidious Poison.name: Insidious Poison
Insidious Poison.flavor: You envenom your weapon with a lethal poison that is exceptionally difficult to shake off. Few survive its touch.
Insidious Poison.onHit: As above, but 2[W] + ability modifier damage plus 10 poison damage, and ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends).

Framing Assassin.name: Framing Assassin
Framing Assassin.flavor: You have mastered a fighting technique in which you lunge swiftly toward one opponent to strike at other foes behind it.
Framing Assassin.effect: You assume the stance of the framing assassin. Until the stance ends, you can use a square adjacent to you that is occupied by an enemy as the square of origin for your weapon attacks.

Quick Formation.name: Quick Formation
Quick Formation.flavor: You lash at your enemies and move your allies into a defensible position.
Quick Formation.onHit:
1[W] + ability modifier damage, and either you shift 4 squares, or each ally within 5 squares of you can shift 2 squares as a free action.
Level 11: 2[W] + ability modifier damage.
Level 21: 3[W] + ability modifier damage.

Slick Negotiator.name: Slick Negotiator
Slick Negotiator.flavor: You don’t let a gaff sabotage your negotiation, and move on as if the misstep never occurred.
Slick Negotiator.trigger: You or an ally in the burst makes a Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, or Streetwise check and dislikes the result.
Slick Negotiator.effect: If you are the target, you gain a +3 power bonus to the skill check result. If an ally is the target, the ally can reroll the skill check, using either result.

Delaying Strike.name: Delaying Strike
Delaying Strike.flavor: A painful hit against your opponent helps you make good your escape.
Delaying Strike.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier damage.
Delaying Strike.effect: Either you shift your speed, or each ally within 2 squares of you can shift one-half his or her speed as a free action.

Blunt Force Strike.name: Blunt Force Strike
Blunt Force Strike.flavor: Your weapon strikes with a satisfying crunch, leaving your opponent unable to defend itself.
Blunt Force Strike.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier damage.

Deft Avoidance.name: Deft Avoidance
Deft Avoidance.flavor: You duck out of the way, slipping to where you can best land your next attack.
Deft Avoidance.trigger: An enemy in the burst you can see misses you with a melee attack.
Deft Avoidance.effect: The target grants combat advantage until the end of its next turn. In addition, either you can shift 2 squares, or each ally in the burst can shift 1 square as a free action.

Sly Gambit.name: Sly Gambit
Sly Gambit.flavor: Your quick strike lures your enemy into a rash counterattack.
Sly Gambit.onHit: As above, but 3[W] + ability modifier damage.

Hounding Presence.name: Hounding Presence
Hounding Presence.flavor: You step in close to your enemy to land your attack but stay in motion, using its proximity to your advantage.
Hounding Presence.onHit: As above, but 5[W] + ability modifier damage.
Hounding Presence.effect: Until the end of the encounter, while you are adjacent to the target either you gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses, or the target grants combat advantage.

Command Decision.name: Command Decision
Command Decision.flavor: As your enemy’s blade comes down, you are forced to decide—your life, or that of your ally?
Command Decision.trigger: You are hit by an attack
Command Decision.target: You or one ally in the burst
Command Decision.effect: If you are the target, you lose a healing surge and gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value. If an ally is the target, that ally is hit by the triggering attack instead of you.

Spirit of Athas.name: Spirit of Athas
Spirit of Athas.flavor: A spirit appears, defending you and your allies with its body.
Spirit of Athas.effect: You conjure a spirit of Athas. You and your allies gain a +1 power bonus to all defenses while adjacent to it. As a standard action, you can dismiss the spirit and make the following melee 1 attack from the spirit’s square.
Spirit of Athas.onHit:
1d10 + ability modifier damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls and all defenses until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 3[W] + ability modifier damage.
Level 21: 4[W] + ability modifier damage.

Scion of Stone.name: Scion of Stone
Scion of Stone.flavor: The ground trembles as a misshapen hulk forms from rocks and dirt to shelter your companions from harm.
Scion of Stone.effect: You conjure a scion of stone that lasts until the end of the encounter. You and your allies gain a +1 power bonus to all defenses while adjacent to it. As a minor action, you can dismiss it to grant you and each ally adjacent to it temporary hit points equal to 5 + one-half your level.

Bloodthirsty Elemental.name: Bloodthirsty Elemental
Bloodthirsty Elemental.flavor: A spirit made of bones, blood, and sand savages your enemy.
Bloodthirsty Elemental.effect: You conjure a bloodthirsty elemental that lasts until the end of your next turn. Enemies grant combat advantage while adjacent to it. As a standard action, you can dismiss it and make a close burst 1 attack centered on its square.
Bloodthirsty Elemental.onHit: As above, but 3d10 + ability modifier damage.

Vengeful Elementals.name: Vengeful Elementals
Vengeful Elementals.flavor: Warped elementals pull themselves from the landscape and scuttle forward to engage the enemy.
Vengeful Elementals.effect: As above, except as a minor action, you can dismiss one vengeful elemental and let one ally adjacent to it make a basic attack with a +6 power bonus to the damage roll as a free action.

Retrieving Elemental.name: Retrieving Elemental
Retrieving Elemental.flavor: The wind elementals gather to form a dust devil that can whisk an ally to safety.
Retrieving Elemental.effect: You conjure a retrieving elemental that lasts until the end of the encounter. You can push any creature that ends its turn in a square adjacent to the retrieving elemental 1 square. When you start your turn, you can move the elemental 1 square before you take any other actions. As a minor action, you can dismiss the elemental, and an ally adjacent to it can shift 5 squares as a free action.

Elemental Justice.name: Elemental Justice
Elemental Justice.flavor: When an ally falls victim to an attack, the elementals leap to your companion’s defense.
Elemental Justice.onHit: As above, but 4d8 + ability modifier damage, plus 4 damage for each bloodied ally with line of sight to the elemental.

Primordial Retribution.name: Primordial Retribution
Primordial Retribution.flavor: Horrific elementals spring forth from the ground and latch onto your enemies, holding them fast and rending their flesh.
Primordial Retribution.effect: You conjure four tortured elementals in four different squares. The elementals last until the end of the encounter. As a standard action, you can make the following melee 1 attack from each elemental’s square.
Primordial Retribution.target: One, two, three, or four creatures, each adjacent to at least one tortured elemental
Primordial Retribution.onHit: As above, but 5d6 + ability modifier damage, and the target is restrained and takes ongoing 5 damage (save ends both).

Elemental Boon.name: Elemental Boon
Elemental Boon.flavor: The favor of elemental powers shines across your allies, transforming their strength into vitality.
Elemental Boon.effect: You conjure a rewarding elemental that lasts until the end of the encounter. You and each ally that spends a healing surge while adjacent to the elemental regains additional hit points equal to your primary ability modifier. When an ally you can see fails a death saving throw, you can dismiss the elemental as a free action to allow the ally to spend a healing surge and gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses until the start of its next turn.

Disrupting Advance.name: Disrupting Advance
Disrupting Advance.flavor: With an attack followed by a violent shove, your enemy flies backward. As it flails for balance, it loses its footing and stumbles into the creatures around it.
Disrupting Advance.onHit:
2[W] + ability modifier damage, and you push the target 2 squares. The target and each enemy adjacent to the target at the end of the push are slowed until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 3[W] + ability modifier damage.
Level 21: 4[W] + ability modifier damage.

Go with the Flow.name: Go with the Flow
Go with the Flow.flavor: You adjust to the shifting battlefield to position yourself where you can resume your bloody work.
Go with the Flow.trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you that you can see moves willingly.
Go with the Flow.effect: You shift half your speed and gain combat advantage against the target until the end of your next turn.

Savage Sweep.name: Savage Sweep
Savage Sweep.flavor: You whip your weapon around you, cutting a swath of bloody carnage.
Savage Sweep.target: Each creature you can see in the burst
Savage Sweep.onHit: As above, but 3[W] + ability modifier damage.

Infuriating Challenge.name: Infuriating Challenge
Infuriating Challenge.flavor: With one precise strike you find your foe’s weak spot, both physically and mentally, and put it off guard for the rest of the battle.
Infuriating Challenge.onHit: As above, but 5[W] + ability modifier damage.

Bloodborn Menace.name: Bloodborn Menace
Bloodborn Menace.flavor: Your skill at the kill gives your enemies pause.
Bloodborn Menace.trigger: You bloody an enemy or reduce an enemy to 0 hit points with a melee attack.
Bloodborn Menace.effect: Each enemy within 10 squares of you that can see you grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Murderous Rampage.name: Murderous Rampage
Murderous Rampage.flavor: The path to victory lies through your opponent. With a devastating strike, you take a step toward that goal.
Murderous Rampage.effect: Until the end of your next turn, whenever any enemy starts its turn adjacent to the target, that enemy takes damage equal to your primary ability modifier.

Bloody Blades.name: Bloody Blades
Bloody Blades.flavor: You whip your weapons around you to keep your enemies from blocking your progress to a swift victory.
Bloody Blades.effect: You can assume the stance of the bloody blades. Until the stance ends, as a free action you can deal damage equal to your primary ability modifier to any enemy that starts its turn adjacent to you. Any enemy you deal damage to cannot shift until the end of your next turn.
Bloody Blades.target: Each enemy you can see in the burst

Perceive Weakness.name: Perceive Weakness
Perceive Weakness.flavor: You spot the flaws in your foe’s technique and can bring this knowledge to bear during your next attack.
Perceive Weakness.trigger: An enemy you can see misses with a melee attack.
Perceive Weakness.effect: Your next melee weapon attack against the target before the end of your next turn gains a +2 power bonus to the attack roll and deals 1[W] extra damage.
Perceive Weakness.special: If your next attack against the target misses, you regain the use of this power.

Adept's Insight.name: Adept's Insight
Adept's Insight.flavor: With a mental focus, you enhance the undeniability of your actions.
Adept's Insight.trigger: You or an ally in the burst makes an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check.
Adept's Insight.effect: You instead add 1d4+1 to the triggering roll.

Slave's Sacrifice.name: Slave's Sacrifice
Slave's Sacrifice.flavor: Your ally takes your place, emboldened by a sudden notion that you are too important to be harmed.
Slave's Sacrifice.trigger: You are hit by an attack.
Slave's Sacrifice.target: One willing ally in the burst
Slave's Sacrifice.effect: You swap places with the target. The target becomes subject to the triggering attack instead of you and gains a +2 bonus to all defenses against the attack.

Unnerving Suggestion.name: Unnerving Suggestion
Unnerving Suggestion.flavor: You stagger an enemy with a mental attack, then send your underling forth to take advantage with a well-timed attack.
Unnerving Suggestion.requirement: You must expend 6 power points each time you use this power.
Unnerving Suggestion.onHit: As above, but 3d8 + ability modifier psychic damage and a +3d6 bonus to damage rolls.

Imperious Torture.name: Imperious Torture
Imperious Torture.flavor: Every thrilling strike and victorious attack your allies make tortures your enemy even more.
Imperious Torture.effect: The target is affected by imperious torture (save ends). While the target is affected by imperious torture, once per round whenever an enemy within 5 squares of the target takes damage, the target takes psychic damage equal to your primary ability modifier. If the enemy was bloodied by that damage, the target also falls prone.

Enforced Competence.name: Enforced Competence
Enforced Competence.flavor: At your urging, your allies work harder and better. There might be some drawbacks, but none you need to suffer.
Enforced Competence.trigger: An ally in the burst makes a skill check or a saving throw and dislikes the result.
Enforced Competence.effect: The target rerolls the check or the saving throw. If this second check or saving throw is not successful, the target takes psychic damage equal to half your healing surge value, and this power is not expended.

Cruel Decree.name: Cruel Decree
Cruel Decree.flavor: With the voice of authority, you call for your allies to take the fight to your enemies.
Cruel Decree.requirement: You must expend 6 power points each time you use this power.
Cruel Decree.onHit: As above, but 4d6 + ability modifier psychic damage and a +6 power bonus to damage rolls.

Face of Defeat.name: Face of Defeat
Face of Defeat.flavor: You make your foe believe defeat is imminent, and your point is reinforced by well-aimed attacks from your followers.
Face of Defeat.effect: The target is dazed (save ends). If the target is hit by an attack while dazed by this power, it instead becomes stunned until the end of your next turn.

Psionic Sustenance.name: Psionic Sustenance
Psionic Sustenance.flavor: Your ally sacrifices his or her well-being to renew your psionic strength.
Psionic Sustenance.effect: The target loses a healing surge, and you regain 2 power points.
Psionic Sustenance.level23: The target loses a healing surge, and you regain 4 power points.

Mark of Thunder.name: Mark of Thunder
Mark of Thunder.flavor: You invoke the fading power of the world as you strike.
Mark of Thunder.onHit:
1[W] + ability modifier thunder damage.
Level 11: 2[W] + ability modifier thunder damage.
Level 21: 3[W] + ability modifier thunder damage.
Mark of Thunder.effect:
You mark the target until the end of your next turn.
Until the mark ends, if the target makes an attack that does not include you, it takes 5 thunder damage.
Level 11: 10 thunder damage.
Level 21: 15 thunder damage.

Sandstep.name: Sandstep
Sandstep.flavor: In a swirl of wind-driven sand, you move across the battlefield, and the sand obscures you and nearby allies.
Sandstep.effect: You shift 3 squares. Until the end of your next turn, you gain concealment, as do your allies while they are adjacent to you.

Lifting Winds.name: Lifting Winds
Lifting Winds.flavor: Primal spirits riding fierce winds propel your ally into battle.
Lifting Winds.target: You or one ally in the burst
Lifting Winds.effect: The target flies a number of squares equal to your primary ability modifier and lands at the end of this movement. Until the end of your next turn, when the target hits an enemy with a melee attack, he or she also pushes the enemy 1 square.

Balm of the Guardian.name: Balm of the Guardian
Balm of the Guardian.flavor: You leech the moisture from the area around you, directing it to your allies and creating kindling for the fire.
Balm of the Guardian.effect: You spend a healing surge. You regain hit points as normal, and each ally in the burst gains temporary hit points equal to one-half your level. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Each enemy within the zone gains vulnerable 5 thunder while it is within the zone.

Armor of the Land.name: Armor of the Land
Armor of the Land.flavor: The land’s blessings wrap themselves around you, encasing you in a shell of wood and stone and thunder.
Armor of the Land.effect: You assume the armor of the land form until the end of your next turn. While in this form, you gain resist 5 to all damage. Once before the end of your next turn, you can make the following attack as an immediate interrupt.
Armor of the Land.trigger: An enemy adjacent to you moves willingly.
Armor of the Land.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier thunder damage.

Armor of Living Dunes.name: Armor of Living Dunes
Armor of Living Dunes.flavor: Primal spirits of sand, stone, and wood infuse your body with energy, transforming you into a creature of desert life and giving you the ability to hurl a blast of sand from your weapon.
Armor of Living Dunes.effect: You assume the armor of living dunes form until the end of your next turn. While in this form, you are immune to forced movement. Once before the end of your next turn, you can use the Armor of Living Dunes Attack power.
Armor of Living Dunes.requirement: The power Armor of Living Dunes must be active in order to use this power.
Armor of Living Dunes.onHit: As above, but 3[W] + ability modifier damage.

Storm of Debris.name: Storm of Debris
Storm of Debris.flavor: Splinters of wood, serrated leaves, and thorny brush whirl around you with thunderous fury, striking your foes and preventing their escape.
Storm of Debris.requirement: The power Storm of Debris must be active in order to use this power.
Storm of Debris.onHit: As above, but 3[W] + ability modifier thunder damage.

Of Wood and Stone.name: Of Wood and Stone
Of Wood and Stone.flavor: Angry primal spirits bind themselves to you, transforming your body into a hulking mass of rock and wood.
Of Wood and Stone.effect:
You assume the form of wood and stone until the end of the encounter. While you are in this form, you and all allies adjacent to you gain resist 5 to all damage and cannot be pulled, pushed, or slid unless you or the ally adjacent to you chooses to be.
    Once before the end of the encounter while you are in this form, you can use the Of Wood and Stone Attack power.
Of Wood and Stone.requirement: The power Of Wood and Stone must be active in order to use this power.
Of Wood and Stone.target: Each enemy in the burst you can see
Of Wood and Stone.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier damage.

Templar's Fist.name: Templar's Fist
Templar's Fist.flavor: You command your foe to submit, crushing its spirit and slowing its flight. The same power that compels your foe to despair fills a nearby ally with brutal zeal.
Templar's Fist.onHit:
1d10 + ability modifier psychic damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 2d10 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Level 21: 3d10 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Templar's Fist.effect: The next ally who hits and damages the target before the end of your next turn gains a +3 power bonus to attack rolls until the end of his or her next turn.

Reward the Obedient.name: Reward the Obedient
Reward the Obedient.flavor: You call upon your subject to slay the enemies of your master, drawing your ally onward into the fray.
Reward the Obedient.effect: The next ally who ends his or her turn adjacent to the target before the end of your next turn can spend a healing surge and make a saving throw.

Fearsome Command.name: Fearsome Command
Fearsome Command.flavor: You cause your foes to hesitate with a spell of magical terror, but your ally takes heart from your authority.
Fearsome Command.onHit: As above, but 5d6 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Fearsome Command.effect: The next ally who hits and damages one of the targets before the end of your next turn automatically succeeds on any one saving throw at the end of his or her turn.

Glare of Oppression.name: Glare of Oppression
Glare of Oppression.flavor: You create a wave of blistering sunlight and mental oppression. It saps your enemies’ will to fight while renewing the vigor of those you command.
Glare of Oppression.onHit: As above, but 4d10 + ability modifier radiant damage.
Glare of Oppression.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Glare of Oppression.effect: The next ally who hits and damages one of the targets before the end of your next turn gains regeneration 3 until the end of the encounter.

Mantle of Might.name: Mantle of Might
Mantle of Might.flavor: An invisible aura of power protects you from enemies that dare to approach.
Mantle of Might.effect: Until the end of your next turn, enemies grant combat advantage and take a -4 penalty to attack rolls against you while adjacent to you. The next ally who hits and damages an enemy adjacent to you before the end of the encounter gains 1 action point.

Fettering Glare.name: Fettering Glare
Fettering Glare.flavor: You create ghostly, constricting iron manacles to pin your foe in place. The manacles draw an enchantment or blight affecting one of your allies away from him.
Fettering Glare.onHit: As above, but 5d8 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Fettering Glare.effect: The next ally who hits and damages one of the targets before the end of your next turn rolls twice on any one attack roll made before the end of his or her next turn, using either result.

Imperious Gaze.name: Imperious Gaze
Imperious Gaze.flavor: You fix your eye on a foe or a friend, driving your ally onward with magical compulsion or crushing your enemy’s will.
Imperious Gaze.onHit: As above, but 4d10 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Imperious Gaze.effect: The next ally who hits and damages one of the targets before the end of the encounter can regain any one expended encounter attack power of this power’s level or lower.

Berate the Weak.name: Berate the Weak
Berate the Weak.flavor: You lash your failing allies with words of scorn, driving them back into the fray with renewed determination.
Berate the Weak.target: Each bloodied, dazed, stunned, or prone ally in the burst
Berate the Weak.effect: Each target can choose to spend a healing surge, automatically remove one dazed or stunned effect, or stand up. In addition, each target in the burst can move his or her speed as a free action, as long as this movement ends with that target adjacent to an enemy.

Excise from Sight.name: Excise from Sight
Excise from Sight.flavor: Magic removes all evidence from your foe’s senses that you or one of your allies exists.
Excise from Sight.special: You can spend a minor action when you use this power to enhance it. If you do so, you can also slide the target 1 square on a hit.
Excise from Sight.onHit:
1d10 + ability modifier psychic damage, and you or one ally within 10 squares of you becomes invisible to the target until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 2d10 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Level 21: 3d10 + ability modifier psychic damage.

Veiled Arcana.name: Veiled Arcana
Veiled Arcana.flavor: You distract observers to conceal the use of arcane power, sometimes catching them off guard.
Veiled Arcana.target: You or one ally you can see in the burst
Veiled Arcana.effect: The target gains combat advantage on his or her next arcane attack before the end of your next turn.

Dazzling Flash.name: Dazzling Flash
Dazzling Flash.flavor: Unleashing a flash of arcane magic, you escape your enemies’ clutches.
Dazzling Flash.special: You can spend a minor action when you use this power to enhance it. If you do so, the target cannot make opportunity attacks or immediate action attacks until the end of your next turn instead of taking a penalty to attack rolls.
Dazzling Flash.effect: Before or after the attack, you can shift 3 squares.
Dazzling Flash.onHit: As above, but 3d8 + ability modifier radiant damage.

Psychic Veil.name: Psychic Veil
Psychic Veil.flavor: A buzzing shroud issues from your mind, convincing your foes that you are a powerful user of psionic power.
Psychic Veil.special: You can spend a minor action when you use this power to enhance it. If you do so, the target takes 5 psychic damage each time it fails a saving throw against this power.
Psychic Veil.onHit: 3d10 + ability modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Psychic Veil.onMiss: Half damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to any check made to discern your use of arcane power until the end of the encounter.

Veiled Escape.name: Veiled Escape
Veiled Escape.flavor: Your subtle magic lends speed to an ally’s feet and calls up dust to conceal your ally’s movement.
Veiled Escape.effect: The next time the target shifts before the end of your next turn, he or she can shift 2 additional squares and gain concealment until the end of his or her next turn.

Sandman's Veil.name: Sandman's Veil
Sandman's Veil.flavor: A spray of mind-stinging particles covers your flight from danger.
Sandman's Veil.special: You can spend a minor action when you use this power to enhance it. If you do so, you can teleport 2 squares instead of shifting 2 squares.
Sandman's Veil.effect: Before or after the attack, you can shift 2 squares.
Sandman's Veil.onHit: As above, but 3d10 + ability modifier psychic damage.

Sequestering Veil.name: Sequestering Veil
Sequestering Veil.flavor: A sparkling mist covers your foes and swirls around them, locking them in place and obscuring their vision.
Sequestering Veil.special: You can spend a minor action when you use this power to enhance it. If you do so, the target takes a -2 penalty to saving throws against this power.
Sequestering Veil.onHit: As above, but 4d6 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Sequestering Veil.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).

Sensory Absorption.name: Sensory Absorption
Sensory Absorption.flavor: Your senses ride atop your target’s senses, allowing you to gain a broader perspective.
Sensory Absorption.effect: You can see and hear as if you were in the target’s space (save ends).
Sensory Absorption.aftereffect: You can see and hear as if you were in the target’s space until the end of your next turn.

Wasteland Fury.name: Wasteland Fury
Wasteland Fury.flavor: You catch the merciless sun’s cruel radiance in your weapon and redirect it to dazzle your foe, covering your movement.
Wasteland Fury.effect: If you use this power while you are not adjacent to any of your allies, you can shift 1 square before or after the attack.
Wasteland Fury.onHit:
1[W] + ability modifier damage. If you have combat advantage against the target, you deal extra damage equal to your primary ability modifier.
Level 11: 2[W] + ability modifier damage.
Level 21: 3[W] + ability modifier damage.

Lone Resolve.name: Lone Resolve
Lone Resolve.flavor: Isolation clarifies your senses, helping you to shrug off your enemies’ attacks.
Lone Resolve.trigger: You start your turn while you are not adjacent to any of your allies.
Lone Resolve.effect: You can make a saving throw with a bonus equal to your primary ability modifier. If the saving throw fails, you do not expend this power.

Stalking the Prey.name: Stalking the Prey
Stalking the Prey.flavor: You see a gap in your foe’s defenses and deliver an attack that leaves your enemy reeling and unable to protect itself.
Stalking the Prey.attack: Primary ability vs. AC. If none of your allies are adjacent to you or the target, you gain combat advantage on the attack.
Stalking the Prey.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier damage.

Nomad's Pursuit.name: Nomad's Pursuit
Nomad's Pursuit.flavor: You catch your prey’s scent. No matter where it flees, you will follow.
Nomad's Pursuit.effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever you start your turn and you are not adjacent to the target or any ally, you can shift a number of squares equal to your primary ability modifier as a free action. This movement ignores difficult terrain. You must end this shift closer to the target.

Dune Dancer.name: Dune Dancer
Dune Dancer.flavor: You roll with the attack, taking a better position where you are bound to make your enemy pay.
Dune Dancer.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack while you are not adjacent to any of your allies.
Dune Dancer.effect: As a free action, you shift a number of squares equal to your primary ability modifier. You gain combat advantage against the target until the end of your next turn.

Flensing Wind Strike.name: Flensing Wind Strike
Flensing Wind Strike.flavor: Your attack creates a sandstorm around the foe, shredding its flesh until it escapes.
Flensing Wind Strike.onHit: As above, but 3[W] + ability modifier damage.

Monstrous Savagery.name: Monstrous Savagery
Monstrous Savagery.flavor: Bloodlust drives you into a wild frenzy, and your attacks fall with shocking power.
Monstrous Savagery.attack: As above, but Primary ability + 2 vs. AC, two attacks.
Monstrous Savagery.onHit: As above, but 10 + ability modifier damage per attack.

Lone Nomad.name: Lone Nomad
Lone Nomad.flavor: You’re toughest when you’re all alone.
Lone Nomad.effect: You assume the lone nomad’s stance. Until the stance ends, you have resist 7 to all damage. If you end your turn adjacent to an ally, this stance ends.

Psychic Surge.name: Psychic Surge
Psychic Surge.flavor: You unleash a psychic shock wave at your enemy, hoping to harness its energy on your next attack.
Psychic Surge.onHit:
1d8 + ability modifier psychic damage, and your attacks against the target before the end of your next turn can score a critical hit on a roll of 18–20.
Level 11: 2d8 + ability modifier psychic damage.
Level 21: 3d8 + ability modifier psychic damage.

Wilder's Armor.name: Wilder's Armor
Wilder's Armor.flavor: You instinctually reinforce your skin with psionic plates as strong as chitin.
Wilder's Armor.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn. If you score a critical hit before the end of your next turn, you also gain temporary hit points equal to 5 + your primary ability modifier.

Wildfire Bolt.name: Wildfire Bolt
Wildfire Bolt.flavor: Your mind unleashes a tearing rift of fire that sears your enemy and scatters a cloud of embers into the air.
Wildfire Bolt.onHit: 4d6 + ability modifier psychic damage. If you score a critical hit with this power, the target and each enemy adjacent to the target take ongoing 15 fire damage (save ends).

Psionic Shelter.name: Psionic Shelter
Psionic Shelter.flavor: A shield of force erupts from your thoughts, protecting you and slamming into your foes.
Psionic Shelter.trigger: An enemy in the burst damages you with an attack.
Psionic Shelter.onHit: 5d8 + ability modifier force damage, and you push the target 4 squares.
Psionic Shelter.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn. Each time you score a critical hit while under the effect of this power, you extend the duration of the power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn and increase the power bonus by 1, and each enemy within 5 squares of you takes 5 psychic damage.

Wild Repulsion.name: Wild Repulsion
Wild Repulsion.flavor: Physical shields manifest around your body, dampening attacks.
Wild Repulsion.effect: You assume the wild repulsion stance. Until the stance ends, you gain resist 5 to all damage. Once per turn, when you score a critical hit with an attack, you increase the resistance by 1, to a maximum of 10.

Mind Clash.name: Mind Clash
Mind Clash.flavor: You fully unleash the power of your mind, crushing your enemy’s will with your reckless, savage onslaught.
Mind Clash.onHit: 4d8 + ability modifier psychic damage. If you score a critical hit with this power, the target takes 20 extra psychic damage and is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Chaotic Thoughts.name: Chaotic Thoughts
Chaotic Thoughts.flavor: You assault your enemy’s mind with confusing thoughts, and it harms its own psyche as it tries to break free from your control.
Chaotic Thoughts.effect: As above, but ongoing 15 psychic damage (save ends).

Psychic Feedback.name: Psychic Feedback
Psychic Feedback.flavor: A mental shield emanates psychic feedback against those who attack you.
Psychic Feedback.effect: You assume the stance of psychic defense. Until the stance ends, when you’re damaged by an attack, the attacker takes 5 psychic damage. When you score a critical hit with an attack, you can end the stance as a free action to deal 10 extra psychic damage on that attack.

Hidden Strike.name: Hidden Strike
Hidden Strike.flavor: You disguise your movements so that no one suspects you are at fault.
Hidden Strike.effect: Make a Bluff check. If your result exceeds the passive Insight of creatures observing you, they believe something or someone else was the source of the triggering attack and treat you as invisible until the start of your next turn.

No Bonds Can Hold.name: No Bonds Can Hold
No Bonds Can Hold.flavor: You were imprisoned once. Never again.
No Bonds Can Hold.trigger: You are affected by a grabbed, restrained, immobilized, or slowed condition that can be ended by an escape attempt or saving throw
No Bonds Can Hold.effect: You make an escape attempt or saving throw (as appropriate) to end the triggering effect with a +2 power bonus.

Repel the Siege.name: Repel the Siege
Repel the Siege.flavor: With the fury of a caged beast, you lash out at those who would hem you in.
Repel the Siege.trigger: An enemy moves to a square to flank you
Repel the Siege.target: Each flanking enemy in the burst
Repel the Siege.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier damage.
Repel the Siege.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you do not grant combat advantage to creatures flanking you.

Turn the Tables.name: Turn the Tables
Turn the Tables.flavor: You feign vulnerability and suddenly turn the tables on your foe, putting it in a terrible position.
Turn the Tables.trigger: An enemy makes a melee attack against you.
Turn the Tables.effect: You shift 1 square. If you are prone, you instead stand up in an unoccupied adjacent square. The triggering enemy is pulled into the square you vacated and is knocked prone. You make the following attack.
Turn the Tables.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier damage.
Turn the Tables.onMiss: Half damage, and you do not gain the bonus to all defenses.

Wary Defense.name: Wary Defense
Wary Defense.flavor: You remain light on your feet as you eye your foes.
Wary Defense.effect: You gain a +1 power bonus to AC. As long as you can make opportunity attacks, the first time an enemy moves adjacent to you on its turn, you can shift 1 square as a free action.

Astonishing Wound.name: Astonishing Wound
Astonishing Wound.flavor: Your weapon appears to come from nowhere and stops your shocked enemy in its tracks.
Astonishing Wound.effect: Make a Bluff check. If your result exceeds your target’s passive Insight score, then the target grants combat advantage to you for the following attack.
Astonishing Wound.onHit: As above, but 4[W] + ability modifier damage.

Who Is Master Now.name: Who Is Master Now
Who Is Master Now.flavor: You use your weapon to draw your foe in close and then entrap it in your arms, where you command its actions like a puppeteer.
Who Is Master Now.target: One creature that is your size, smaller than you, or one size category larger.
Who Is Master Now.onHit: 1[W] + ability modifier damage, and you grab the target and it is dominated (save ends both). If the grab ends, the target is no longer dominated.
Who Is Master Now.effect: While you have the target grabbed and dominated by this power, you can exchange positions with the target as an immediate interrupt triggered by an enemy making a melee or ranged attack against you. The triggering attack affects the grabbed enemy instead. Exchanging positions with the target ends the grab and the dominate.
Who Is Master Now.onMiss: 1[W] + ability modifier damage, and you do not grab the target.

Opportune Distraction.name: Opportune Distraction
Opportune Distraction.flavor: You draw the attention of your foes elsewhere and make the most of the opportunity.
Opportune Distraction.effect: Make a Bluff check. If your result exceeds the passive Insight of creatures observing you, they cannot make opportunity attacks against you until the end of your next turn.

Aqua Regia.name: Aqua Regia
Aqua Regia.flavor: You apply powerful acid to a metal object.
keywords:
Melee 1

Requirement: You must have an alchemy case on your person.

Target: One metal object

Effect: The next creature that attempts a Thievery or Strength check to open, break, bend, or destroy the target before the end of your next turn gains a +5 power bonus to that check.
Aqua Regia.requirement: You must have an alchemy case on your person.
Aqua Regia.effect: The next creature that attempts a Thievery or Strength check to open, break, bend, or destroy the target before the end of your next turn gains a +5 power bonus to that check.

Alchemist's Escape.name: Alchemist's Escape
Alchemist's Escape.flavor: You cover your retreat with a cloud of thick red smoke.
Alchemist's Escape.requirement: You must have an alchemy case on your person.
Alchemist's Escape.effect: The burst creates a zone that is heavily obscured. It lasts until the end of your next turn. In addition, you can move up to your speed, and this movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures in the zone.

Goblin Oil.name: Goblin Oil
Goblin Oil.flavor: A flask of alchemical oil makes a patch of floor almost impassable—and it burns nicely, too.
Goblin Oil.requirement: You must have an alchemy case on your person.
Goblin Oil.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain until the end of the encounter. Any creature that enters the zone must succeed on an Acrobatics check against a DC equal to 10 + one-half your level or fall prone. Each creature that falls prone in the zone gains vulnerable 5 fire until the end of its next turn.

Distracting Attack.name: Distracting Attack
Distracting Attack.flavor: At your command, your animal friend darts forward to bite, rake, or peck at your foe.
Distracting Attack.requirement: Your animal minion must be within 5 squares of you.
Distracting Attack.effect: You gain combat advantage against the target until the end of your turn.

Timely Trick.name: Timely Trick
Timely Trick.flavor: You direct your animal minion to perform a special task.
Timely Trick.target: Your animal minion in the burst
Timely Trick.effect: Your minion performs a move action and a standard action as you direct. It can accomplish any action it is physically capable of performing (with the DM’s consent).

Guard My Back.name: Guard My Back
Guard My Back.flavor: Your animal leaps into battle to protect your back.
Guard My Back.trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you where it flanks you, and your animal minion is adjacent to you.
Guard My Back.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses, and enemies do not gain combat advantage for flanking you.

Shared Sight.name: Shared Sight
Shared Sight.flavor: You see through your animal minion’s eyes.
Shared Sight.effect: Your animal minion can take a move action and a standard action as you direct, and you share its senses until the end of your next turn. You do not need to have line of sight or line of effect to the animal to use or sustain this power.
Shared Sight.sustainStandard: You share your minion's senses until the end of your next turn, and it can take a move action and a standard action.

Argent Rain.name: Argent Rain
Argent Rain.flavor: You bring forth a shower of blue-white molten metal droplets, searing your foes and threatening any creature that ventures into the area.
Argent Rain.effect:
The burst creates a zone that lasts until the start of your next turn. Any creature that enters the zone or ends its turn there takes 5 fire damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.
    Level 11: 10 fire damage.
    Level 21: 15 fire damage.

Extension.name: Extension
Extension.flavor: You extend the duration of a spell for just a few more seconds.
Extension.effect: You sustain a power that normally requires a minor action to sustain.
Extension.special: You can use this power as a minor action to sustain a power that normally requires a move action to sustain.

Far Reaching.name: Far Reaching
Far Reaching.flavor: You extend the range of a spell beyond its normal limit.
Far Reaching.trigger: You use a ranged or area arcane attack power.
Far Reaching.effect: You double the range of the triggering power. For example, a ranged 5 power becomes a ranged 10 power, and a power with a range of “area burst 2 within 10” becomes area burst 2 within 20. The area affected remains unchanged.

Mnemonic Enhancer.name: Mnemonic Enhancer
Mnemonic Enhancer.flavor: You recall to mind a spell you’ ve already used in this battle.
Mnemonic Enhancer.requirement: You must have expended all your arcane encounter attack powers.
Mnemonic Enhancer.effect: You regain your lowest-level expended arcane encounter attack power.

Color Orb.name: Color Orb
Color Orb.flavor: You throw a brightly shining orb of swirling colors at your foe, momentarily dazing it.
Color Orb.onHit:
1d8 + highest ability modifier radiant damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 2d8 + highest ability modifier radiant damage.
    Level 21: 3d8 + highest ability modifier radiant damage.

Disappear.name: Disappear
Disappear.flavor: You fade from sight for a moment.
Disappear.effect: You become invisible until the end of this turn.

Winged Step.name: Winged Step
Winged Step.flavor: You create semisolid wings around your ankles, which bear you up into the air for a single swift leap.
Winged Step.effect: You fly up to 6 squares and land. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Minor Polymorph.name: Minor Polymorph
Minor Polymorph.flavor: You turn yourself into a small, harmless animal. This form is not terribly useful in a fight, but it might help you avoid one.
Minor Polymorph.effect: You assume the form of a Tiny natural beast until the end of your next turn. While in this form, you cannot attack, but you have the senses of your chosen form and gain its movement modes. If your chosen form has the aquatic keyword, you also gain it while in this form. You can return to your normal form as a minor action. If you are flying when you return to your normal form, you descend to the ground without taking falling damage. Observers can tell that you’re a supernatural version of your animal form by making a successful Insight check against a DC equal to 15 + one-half your level.
Minor Polymorph.sustainMinor: Your animal form persists until the end of your next turn.

Smiting Symbol.name: Smiting Symbol
Smiting Symbol.flavor: The power of your deity shields a nearby ally while you smite the foe.
Smiting Symbol.effect:
Choose one ally within 3 squares of you. That ally gains a +2 bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn. He or she also gains temporary hit points equal to 3 + one-half your level.
    Level 11: 2[W] + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3[W] + highest ability modifier damage.

Shining Symbol.name: Shining Symbol
Shining Symbol.flavor: Your holy symbol gleams with a brilliant radiance, searing your foes and dazzling them for a short time.
Shining Symbol.onHit:
1d8 + highest ability modifier radiant damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 2d8 + highest ability modifier radiant damage.
    Level 21: 3d8 + highest ability modifier radiant damage.

Word of Comfort.name: Word of Comfort
Word of Comfort.flavor: You recite a verse offering a prayer of comfort and endurance in the face of adversity.
Word of Comfort.target: You and each ally in the burst
Word of Comfort.effect: Each target can make a saving throw. In addition, each target regains 5 hit points, or 10 hit points if he or she is bloodied.

Word of Protection.name: Word of Protection
Word of Protection.flavor: You protect yourself and nearby allies with a prayer of peace.
Word of Protection.target: You and each ally in the burst
Word of Protection.effect: Each target gains a +5 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn. If any target makes an attack, the effect ends for all targets.
Word of Protection.sustainStandard: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Sanctifying Word.name: Sanctifying Word
Sanctifying Word.flavor: Your prayer sanctifies the ground on which you stand, protecting allies and daunting foes that dare to approach.
Sanctifying Word.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in the zone, each ally gains a +2 bonus to all defenses and adds 5 to his or her healing surge value. Any undead creature that ends its turn in the zone takes 5 radiant damage.
Sanctifying Word.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Use Vulnerability.name: Use Vulnerability
Use Vulnerability.flavor: You know the strengths and weaknesses of the creature you’re facing.
Use Vulnerability.trigger: You succeed on a monster knowledge check against a monster that you can see or hear.
Use Vulnerability.effect:
If your check result meets or exceeds the hard DC for the monster’s level, you gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses against the monster's attacks until the end of your next turn. Additionally, until the end of your next turn, you gain a power bonus to damage rolls against the target equal to your Intelligence modifier, but not when you deal damage that the target resists.
    If your check result does not meet or exceed the hard DC, your attacks against the target deal only half damage until the end of your next turn.

Useful Lore.name: Useful Lore
Useful Lore.flavor: You recall a shining example of a hero who succeeded in a challenging task, imbuing yourself with a portion of his or her skill.
Useful Lore.effect: Choose one skill. Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +5 power bonus to checks with that skill.

Inimical Lore.name: Inimical Lore
Inimical Lore.flavor: You enhance your allies’ attacks with energy that you know can devastate the foe you’re fighting.
Inimical Lore.target: You and each ally in the burst
Inimical Lore.effect: Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder. Until the end of your next turn, any untyped damage each target would deal with attacks is of the chosen type instead.

Defensive Lore.name: Defensive Lore
Defensive Lore.flavor: You pronounce a word or name that is disruptive to creatures of a particular origin, causing their existence to falter for a few moments.
Defensive Lore.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Choose aberrant, fey, elemental, immortal, natural, or shadow. Until the end of your next turn, creatures of that origin take a -2 penalty to attack rolls and to all defenses while in the zone, and attacks by such creatures deal only half damage to targets inside the zone.
Defensive Lore.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Cast Fortune.name: Cast Fortune
Cast Fortune.flavor: You perform a minor augury or reading that reveals to you what fortune holds for the subject this day.
Cast Fortune.effect: Roll a d20 three times when you use this power, and note the results, in order. These results replace, in order, the next three d20 rolls the target makes for any of the following types of rolls: attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks. At the DM’s discretion, trivial rolls and rolls that the target makes in nondangerous or nonstressful situations can’t be replaced by your recorded results. When all three results have been used or when you next take an extended rest, the effect ends. The target doesn’t know if his or her fortune is good or bad unless you tell the target.
Cast Fortune.special: Once anyone has used this power on an ally, that ally cannot be targeted by the power again until after he or she finishes an extended rest.

Clairvoyance.name: Clairvoyance
Clairvoyance.flavor: In your mind you see a vision of a place beyond the perception of your own eyes.
Clairvoyance.effect: You gain darkvision until the end of your next turn. Choose any spot within 20 squares of you. You need not have line of sight or line of effect to the spot you choose. You can see from both your location and that spot until the end of your next turn. You can attempt Perception checks to notice small details, such as reading a letter lying on a desk near your point of observation. Sight is the only sense your clairvoyance conveys—you can’t hear or smell from your point of observation.
Clairvoyance.sustainStandard: You continue to observe from your chosen spot and continue to have darkvision until the end of your next turn.

Moment of Peril.name: Moment of Peril
Moment of Peril.flavor: You recognize an enemy’s attack as a moment of peril that you’ ve already foreseen.
Moment of Peril.trigger: You are hit by an attack.
Moment of Peril.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn. After the attack is resolved, you can shift 1 square as a free action.

Eye of Seeing.name: Eye of Seeing
Eye of Seeing.flavor: An invisible, intangible third eye opens on your brow, enabling you to perceive truths that are normally hidden.
Eye of Seeing.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you see invisible creatures and objects. In addition, you gain a +5 power bonus to Insight checks and Perception checks.
Eye of Seeing.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Valiant Charge.name: Valiant Charge
Valiant Charge.flavor: You charge your enemy and strike out, momentarily holding it where it stands.
Valiant Charge.trigger: You hit a creature with a charge attack.
Valiant Charge.effect: The creature is immobilized until the end of its next turn.

Battle Riding.name: Battle Riding
Battle Riding.flavor: You quickly guide your mount away from danger.
Battle Riding.trigger: A mount you are riding is damaged by an attack.
Battle Riding.effect: Your mount takes half damage from the triggering attack. After the attack is resolved, your mount can shift 1 square.

Indefatigable.name: Indefatigable
Indefatigable.flavor: You call upon your iron self-discipline to shake off the effects of enemy blows.
Indefatigable.effect: You regain hit points equal to your healing surge value, and you can make a saving throw.

Loyal Stand.name: Loyal Stand
Loyal Stand.flavor: You protect nearby allies with a flurry of blocks and parries for a short time, refusing to give ground.
Loyal Stand.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of your next turn. You and your allies gain a +2 power bonus to AC while in the aura, and you can reduce the distance of push, pull, or slide effects against you or your allies in the aura by 1 square.

Guardian's Counter.name: Guardian's Counter
Guardian's Counter.flavor: Seeing a friend in danger, you step up to take the attack meant for your ally—and then you strike back.
Guardian's Counter.trigger: An ally within 2 squares of you is hit by an attack and you are not included in the attack.
Guardian's Counter.effect: You and the ally shift up to 2 squares as a free action, swapping positions. You become the target of the triggering attack, in place of the ally. After the attack is resolved, you can make a basic attack against the attacker.

Guardian's Defense.name: Guardian's Defense
Guardian's Defense.flavor: Fighting side by side with an ally, you guard his or her back.
Guardian's Defense.target: You and one ally in the burst
Guardian's Defense.effect: Until the end of your next turn, each target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses. Additionally, enemies cannot gain combat advantage against either target until the end of your next turn.

Ready for Anything.name: Ready for Anything
Ready for Anything.flavor: Your enemies think they caught you off guard; they’re wrong.
Ready for Anything.trigger: You are surprised at the start of an encounter.

Watch Out!.name: Watch Out!
Watch Out!.flavor: You take a hit intended for one of your friends.
Watch Out!.trigger: An ally adjacent to you is hit by an attack that does not include you as a target.
Watch Out!.effect: The triggering attack misses your ally and hits you instead. After the attack is resolved, you can spend a healing surge.

Shield of Devotion.name: Shield of Devotion
Shield of Devotion.flavor: With a quick prayer you bestow minor healing on a stricken ally, then prepare yourself to smite the enemy who struck your friend.
Shield of Devotion.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you takes damage from an enemy attack.
Shield of Devotion.effect:
The target regains hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier or Charisma modifier. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to your next attack roll against the enemy that damaged the target.
    Level 11: The target regains hit points equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier or Charisma modifier.
    Level 21: The target regains hit points equal to 10 + your Wisdom modifier or Charisma modifier.

Hospitaler's Prayer.name: Hospitaler's Prayer
Hospitaler's Prayer.flavor: Your prayer alleviates one malady afflicting your comrade and shields him or her from harm for a short time.
Hospitaler's Prayer.effect: The target can make a saving throw. Until the end of your next turn, the target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses, or a +4 power bonus if the saving throw you grant with this power fails.

Radiant Stride.name: Radiant Stride
Radiant Stride.flavor: Cloaking yourself in a bright nimbus of light, you go to the side of a wounded comrade.
Radiant Stride.effect: You shift up to your speed. You must end the shift adjacent to a bloodied or unconscious ally. Until the end of your next turn, you gain partial concealment, and your allies also have partial concealment while adjacent to you.

Fight on, Friend.name: Fight on, Friend
Fight on, Friend.flavor: You heal a badly wounded companion, restoring health and banishing one affliction or hindering condition of your choice.
Fight on, Friend.effect: The target regains hit points equal to twice his or her healing surge value. In addition, the target automatically saves against one effect that a save can end.

Noble Presence.name: Noble Presence
Noble Presence.flavor: You encourage your allies to improve their positions and stand firm against the foe.
Noble Presence.target: One or two allies in the burst
Noble Presence.effect: Each target can shift up to 2 squares as a free action, and each target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Noble Influence.name: Noble Influence
Noble Influence.flavor: If a logical argument or a heartfelt appeal won’t move your adversary, perhaps your exalted title will.
Noble Influence.effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to your next Intimidate check made before the end of the encounter. Until the end of the encounter, you can also use Intimidate in place of your next Bluff check or Diplomacy check.

Inspiring Recovery.name: Inspiring Recovery
Inspiring Recovery.flavor: When you shake off the lingering effects of an enemy’s attack, you provide an ally with the inspiration to do the same.
Inspiring Recovery.trigger: You succeed on a saving throw.
Inspiring Recovery.effect: The target can make a saving throw with a +2 power bonus.

Urge to Action.name: Urge to Action
Urge to Action.flavor: With one quick word, you spur a hesitating ally into action.
Urge to Action.trigger: An ally makes an initiative check, and the result is lower than your initiative check result.
Urge to Action.effect: The target’s initiative check result improves to your initiative check result.

Surefooted Stride.name: Surefooted Stride
Surefooted Stride.flavor: Your expert woodcraft allows you to move easily through difficult terrain and use it to your advantage in battle.
Surefooted Stride.effect: You move up to your speed, ignoring difficult terrain. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 bonus to AC and Reflex if you are in difficult terrain, and you gain combat advantage against enemies that are in difficult terrain.

Stag's Bound.name: Stag's Bound
Stag's Bound.flavor: Fleet-footed as the wild deer, you fly over a treacherous surface or make a daring leap.
Stag's Bound.effect: You move up to your speed +2. During this movement, and until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to Athletics checks to jump and Acrobatics checks to balance or reduce falling damage. Any jump you make is considered to have a running start, and you can move at full speed while balancing.

Eagle's Eye.name: Eagle's Eye
Eagle's Eye.flavor: You fix your eye on a distant target, seeing it with exceptional clarity.
Eagle's Eye.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain combat advantage with your ranged attack powers and area attack powers, and your weapon attacks take no penalty for long range. You also gain a +4 power bonus to Perception checks to detect hidden objects or creatures.

Lynx's Reflexes.name: Lynx's Reflexes
Lynx's Reflexes.flavor: Sensing a sudden threat, you throw yourself out of danger’s way.
Lynx's Reflexes.effect: You shift up to 2 squares and gain a +4 power bonus to AC and Reflex against the trap’s attack.

Running Slash.name: Running Slash
Running Slash.flavor: You dart past a foe, attacking as you pass by.
Running Slash.effect: You move up to your speed and make the following attack at any point during your move. This movement does not provoke an opportunity attack from the target.
Running Slash.onHit:
1[W] + highest ability modifier damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 2[W] + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3[W] + highest ability modifier damage.

Infuriating Taunt.name: Infuriating Taunt
Infuriating Taunt.flavor: You enrage an enemy by mocking its failure.
Infuriating Taunt.trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you misses you with an attack.
Infuriating Taunt.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Infuriating Taunt.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (including rolls against you) until it hits you with an attack.

Fools' Dance.name: Fools' Dance
Fools' Dance.flavor: When pressed by your enemies, you turn their numbers against them. The closer you are to your enemies, the farther you are from harm.
Fools' Dance.effect: Until the end of your next turn, each time you are attacked, you gain a power bonus to all defenses against that attack. The bonus equals the number of enemies adjacent to you when the attack is made. In addition, until the end of your next turn, each time you are missed by an attack, you can shift 1 square as a free action.

Unlikely Escape.name: Unlikely Escape
Unlikely Escape.flavor: With a quick twist of your torso, you slip free from a situation that impedes you.
Unlikely Escape.requirement: You must be restrained, slowed, immobilized, or flanked by enemies.
Unlikely Escape.effect: You end one effect on you that is immobilizing, restraining, or slowing you, and you shift up to 3 squares.

Takedown Strike.name: Takedown Strike
Takedown Strike.flavor: You sweep or shoot through an enemy’s legs and knock it to the ground—hard.
Takedown Strike.trigger: You hit an enemy adjacent to you with an attack.
Takedown Strike.effect: The target takes extra damage from the triggering attack equal to the ability modifier used in the triggering attack, and you knock the target prone.

Sellsword's Ploy.name: Sellsword's Ploy
Sellsword's Ploy.flavor: Your enemy attacks when it appears to have an advantage, but you’re ready for it.
Sellsword's Ploy.trigger: An enemy attacks you while it has combat advantage against you.
Sellsword's Ploy.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to 3 + one-half your level. Until the end of your next turn, you do not grant combat advantage to the triggering enemy, and it grants combat advantage to you.

I'm Right Here.name: I'm Right Here
I'm Right Here.flavor: When an enemy tries to slip away from you, you stick to it.
I'm Right Here.trigger: An enemy adjacent to you moves away from you.
I'm Right Here.effect: You shift up to 2 squares to a square adjacent to the triggering enemy.

Brutal Survivor.name: Brutal Survivor
Brutal Survivor.flavor: The best way to survive a fight is to take out your enemies as fast as you can.
Brutal Survivor.effect: Until the end of the encounter, each time you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points or score a critical hit, you gain temporary hit points equal to 3 + one-half your level.

Surprise Strike.name: Surprise Strike
Surprise Strike.flavor: You follow up on the advantage granted by a surprised or distracted enemy to strike a crippling blow.
Surprise Strike.trigger: When using a basic attack or an at-will weapon attack power, you hit an enemy that is granting combat advantage to you.
Surprise Strike.effect: The enemy is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Burst of Speed.name: Burst of Speed
Burst of Speed.flavor: You put on an impressive burst of speed.
Burst of Speed.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to speed until the end of this turn. Until the start of your next turn, you do not grant combat advantage or take a penalty to attack rolls for running.

Out of Sight.name: Out of Sight
Out of Sight.flavor: You slip into the underbrush or the shadows, vanishing with uncanny skill.
Out of Sight.effect: You shift 1 square, and then you move up to your speed. If you end your movement in a square with partial cover or partial concealment, you can make a Stealth check as a free action to hide from nonadjacent enemies.

Improvise Ambush.name: Improvise Ambush
Improvise Ambush.flavor: With a sudden distraction, a bluff, or a quick motion, you turn a fair fight into a surprise attack.
Improvise Ambush.trigger: You roll initiative at the start of an encounter and are not surprised.
Improvise Ambush.effect: You and each of your allies gain a +5 power bonus to initiative checks for this encounter.

Take Heart, Friend!.name: Take Heart, Friend!
Take Heart, Friend!.flavor: When all looks dark, you muster a cry of hope to carry your ally through.
Take Heart, Friend!.effect:
The target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn and 5 temporary hit points.
    Level 11: 10 temporary hit points.
    Level 21: 15 temporary hit points.

Honorable Challenge (Neverwinter Noble).name: Honorable Challenge (Neverwinter Noble)
Honorable Challenge (Neverwinter Noble).flavor: You issue a resounding challenge, thwarting all foes that attempt to ignore you.
Honorable Challenge (Neverwinter Noble).effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in the aura, enemies take a -2 penalty to attack rolls against any creature other than you.

Cover Your Ally.name: Cover Your Ally
Cover Your Ally.flavor: You surge forward and take the blow meant for your companion, hurling your ally away from harm.
Cover Your Ally.trigger: An ally within 3 squares of you is attacked, and you are not included in the attack.
Cover Your Ally.effect: You and your ally each shift up to 3 squares as a free action, swapping positions. You become the target of the triggering attack instead of the ally.

Pillar of Lordly Might.name: Pillar of Lordly Might
Pillar of Lordly Might.flavor: You stand tall, commanding the attention and deference of all who look upon you.
Pillar of Lordly Might.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses and to saving throws, you gain a +5 power bonus to Diplomacy checks, and you are immobilized. Any enemy that attacks you grants combat advantage until the end of its next turn.
Pillar of Lordly Might.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Understand Language.name: Understand Language
Understand Language.flavor: Oghma’s guidance provides understanding, and the secrets of a language are revealed to you for a short time.
Understand Language.effect: Choose a language you have heard or seen within the past 24 hours. Until the end of the encounter, you can read and understand that language.

Sudden Insight.name: Sudden Insight
Sudden Insight.flavor: A moment before you would fail, your mind becomes open to a different way to accomplish your goal.
Sudden Insight.trigger: You make a skill check and dislike the result.
Sudden Insight.effect: You can reroll the skill check. Use the second roll, even if it’s lower.

Learned Response.name: Learned Response
Learned Response.flavor: Your knowledge of others’ likely actions allows you to react swiftly to danger.
Learned Response.effect: Make an Insight check. You can use either result for your initiative check.

Bad Idea.name: Bad Idea
Bad Idea.flavor: With a deft twist of your body, you show your foe that you are not an easy target.
Bad Idea.trigger: An adjacent creature makes an attack roll against you.
Bad Idea.effect: You slide the target up to 2 squares to a square adjacent to you, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn.

Tactical Inspiration.name: Tactical Inspiration
Tactical Inspiration.flavor: Inspired by your god, you move in a blur around your foe, at the same time guiding your ally into an advantageous position.
Tactical Inspiration.effect: You shift up to 3 squares to a square adjacent to an enemy. Then, an ally within 5 squares of you can shift up to 3 squares as a free action.

Harper's Healing Boon.name: Harper's Healing Boon
Harper's Healing Boon.flavor: Your Harper pin gleams with silver radiance, shielding you from a vicious blow and bolstering your health.
Harper's Healing Boon.trigger: You are hit by an attack.
Harper's Healing Boon.effect: You take only half damage from the attack. After the attack is resolved, you can make a saving throw.

Unexpected Ally.name: Unexpected Ally
Unexpected Ally.flavor: You trick your opponent into thinking you’re an ally.
Unexpected Ally.effect: The target cannot make opportunity attacks against you, and the target grants combat advantage to you (save ends both). The effect ends if you attack the target.

Resourceful Dastard.name: Resourceful Dastard
Resourceful Dastard.flavor: You use your environment to frustrate your foes’ attempts to harm you.
Resourceful Dastard.effect: You enter the resourceful dastard stance. Until the stance ends, you gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses when you have any cover or concealment, and you ignore difficult terrain when shifting.

Body of the Rat.name: Body of the Rat
Body of the Rat.flavor: You scent danger in the air. Quick as thought, you transform into a more appropriate form for flight or investigation.
Body of the Rat.effect:
You change from your humanoid form to the form of a Tiny rat, or vice versa. When you change from rat form to humanoid form, you can shift 1 square.
    While in rat form, you cannot attack. You retain your game statistics, but gain a climb speed equal to half your normal speed, and a +4 bonus to Stealth checks. Your equipment becomes part of your rat form, and you drop any other items you are holding. You continue to gain the benefits of the equipment you wear, except shields and item powers. While equipment is part of your rat form, it cannot be removed, and anything in a container that is part of your rat form is inaccessible.
Body of the Rat.special: You can use this power only once per round.

Hybrid Bite.name: Hybrid Bite
Hybrid Bite.flavor: You express the wildness running through you, melding your normal form with your inner rat.
Hybrid Bite.effect: You change from your humanoid form to the form of a rat–humanoid hybrid, or vice versa. While in hybrid form, you retain your normal game statistics and size. You also retain your equipment, and can use it normally. In addition, you can use the secondary power at will.
Hybrid Bite.special: You can use this power only once per round.
Hybrid Bite.requirement: The power Hybrid Bite must be active in order to use this power.
Hybrid Bite.secondaryAttack:
Strength or Dexterity vs. AC. You gain a +4 bonus to the attack roll.
    Level 21: The bonus increases to +6.
Hybrid Bite.secondaryOnHit:
1d8 + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage and ongoing 5 damage (save ends).
    Level 21: 2d8 + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage.

Savage Hiss.name: Savage Hiss
Savage Hiss.flavor: You dip into your inner beast and hiss in challenge as you land a brutal strike, cowing the craven fools around you.
Savage Hiss.effect: Each target takes a -4 penalty to attack rolls made against you until the end of your next turn.

Dead Rat Stealth.name: Dead Rat Stealth
Dead Rat Stealth.flavor: Your inner rat helps you slip past undetected.
Dead Rat Stealth.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to Stealth checks and Thievery checks. If you dislike the result of a Stealth check or a Thievery check, you can end this effect as a free action to reroll the check with a +5 bonus.

Intuitive Leap.name: Intuitive Leap
Intuitive Leap.flavor: A brief flicker of prescience forewarns you of danger, and like a rat, you spring into motion before anyone has a chance to react.
Intuitive Leap.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to the initiative check, and you can stand up or move up to your speed.

Blink Away.name: Blink Away
Blink Away.flavor: You retreat through folded space to avoid danger.
Blink Away.trigger: An enemy ends its turn adjacent to you.

Evasive Step.name: Evasive Step
Evasive Step.flavor: You feel the world slip away around you, taking your enemy’s attack with it.
Evasive Step.requirement: Your fey step must not be expended.
Evasive Step.trigger: An enemy hits or misses you with an attack.

Feywild Will.name: Feywild Will
Feywild Will.flavor: Your strength of will overwhelms any effort to impede or dissuade you.
Feywild Will.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to Will and a +2 power bonus to saving throws. Each time you succeed on a saving throw before the end of the encounter, you gain temporary hit points equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

Thunder Stomp.name: Thunder Stomp
Thunder Stomp.flavor: Your foot comes down with the impact of a thunderbeast, shocking nearby enemies into inaction and hesitation.
Thunder Stomp.effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in the aura, enemies cannot make opportunity attacks.

Spiritual Guidance.name: Spiritual Guidance
Spiritual Guidance.flavor: You feel the spirits of your ancestors around you, and in their barely discernible whispers, you hear the truth.
Spiritual Guidance.trigger: You make a History, a Nature, or a Religion check and dislike the result.
Spiritual Guidance.effect: You reroll the check with a +5 power bonus. Use the second result, even if it’s lower.

Strength of the Beast.name: Strength of the Beast
Strength of the Beast.flavor: Your heart pumps thunderously in your chest as your body strains.
Strength of the Beast.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +4 power bonus to Athletics checks and Strength ability checks.

Spirit Swarm.name: Spirit Swarm
Spirit Swarm.flavor: Flickering phantasms of ghostly warriors swirl through the area, hampering your foes and aiding your allies.
Spirit Swarm.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Enemies in the zone cannot regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. Whenever you or an ally ends his or her turn in the zone, that character gains 5 temporary hit points.

Body of the Wolf.name: Body of the Wolf
Body of the Wolf.flavor: Your flesh flows, your bones twist, and you lift your snout to howl.
Body of the Wolf.effect:
You change from your humanoid form to the form of a wolf, or vice versa. When you change from wolf form to humanoid form, you can shift 1 square.
    While in wolf form, you retain your normal game statistics and size, but gain a +1 bonus to speed. Your equipment becomes part of your wolf form. You continue to gain the benefits of the equipment you wear, except shields and item powers. While equipment is part of your wolf form, it cannot be removed, and anything in a container that is part of your wolf form is inaccessible.
    You gain proficiency with your bite while in wolf form. Treat your bite as a melee weapon with a +3 proficiency bonus, a 1d8 damage die, and the enhancement bonus of your primary weapon.
Body of the Wolf.special: You can use this power only once per round.

Bite of the Wolf.name: Bite of the Wolf
Bite of the Wolf.flavor: Your attack catches your enemy unaware and drags the foe down.
Bite of the Wolf.trigger: Your melee attack hits an enemy that is granting you combat advantage.

Blood of the Wolf.name: Blood of the Wolf
Blood of the Wolf.flavor: Primal potency flows through your veins, sealing your wounds as soon as you sustain them.
Blood of the Wolf.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you have regeneration equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier while you are bloodied. If you are damaged with a silvered weapon, your regeneration does not function on your next turn. As a minor action, you can end this effect and spend a healing surge.

Soul of the Wolf.name: Soul of the Wolf
Soul of the Wolf.flavor: You take on the aspect of the beast within, becoming a hulking creature of nightmare.
Soul of the Wolf.effect:
You change into a hybrid form, combining the most fearsome aspects of wolf and humanoid. You retain all your equipment, armor, and weapons, and can use them normally. You gain temporary hit points equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier.
    You gain proficiency with your bite while in hybrid form. Treat your bite as a melee weapon with a +3 proficiency bonus, a 1d8 damage die, and the enhancement bonus of your primary weapon.
    You also gain the following benefits while in your hybrid form:
     +2 power bonus to Fortitude, Athletics checks, Intimidate checks, and damage rolls.
     +2 power bonus to speed.
    You can end the effect and resume your normal form as a free action on your turn.

Scholar of Ancient Ways.name: Scholar of Ancient Ways
Scholar of Ancient Ways.flavor: You gain extra insight from your study of your people’s past—and sometimes, it seems, from your ancestors whispering to you directly.
Scholar of Ancient Ways.trigger: You would make an Intelligence- or Wisdom-based ability check or skill check.
Scholar of Ancient Ways.effect: You make a History check in place of any other Intelligence-based check, or a Dungeoneering check in place of any other Wisdom-based check.

Noble Indomitability.name: Noble Indomitability
Noble Indomitability.flavor: The pride and the sheer determination of your ancestry allow you to push ahead when others are forced back.
Noble Indomitability.trigger: You are subjected to a pull, push, or slide.
Noble Indomitability.effect: You lose one healing surge, you negate the forced movement, and you can shift up to 3 squares.

Body over Mind.name: Body over Mind
Body over Mind.flavor: The legendary strength of your people burns through your veins, washing your mind and body clear.
Body over Mind.effect: You lose one healing surge and instead succeed on the saving throw.

Eyes of Night.name: Eyes of Night
Eyes of Night.flavor: A moment’s concentration lets all your senses touch the darkness.
Eyes of Night.effect: You gain blindsight 10 until the end of your next turn.

Flitting Shadow.name: Flitting Shadow
Flitting Shadow.flavor: You step back into the real world—but only partially.
Flitting Shadow.trigger: You reappear after using any teleportation power.
Flitting Shadow.effect: Until the end of your next turn or until you attack, you become insubstantial and phasing, and you gain vulnerable 5 radiant. In addition, you can make Stealth checks to become hidden if you have any cover or concealment, and you can use cover granted by your allies both to become hidden and to remain hidden.

Binding Shade.name: Binding Shade
Binding Shade.flavor: The shadows you command squeeze tight about your enemy’s soul.
Binding Shade.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack.
Binding Shade.effect: After the attack is resolved, you gain partial concealment and combat advantage against that enemy until the end of your next turn.

Dancing Shadows (Scion of Shadow).name: Dancing Shadows (Scion of Shadow)
Dancing Shadows (Scion of Shadow).flavor: You step from shadow to shadow with supernatural grace.
Dancing Shadows (Scion of Shadow).effect: You teleport up to 6 squares. Until the end of the encounter, you can teleport up to 3 squares as a move action once per round. Each time you teleport using this power, the destination space must be an area of dim light or darkness.

Hellfire and Brimstone.name: Hellfire and Brimstone
Hellfire and Brimstone.flavor: Your brand burns, searing through clothing and flesh as hellfire springs up around you.
Hellfire and Brimstone.effect:
Creatures in the burst take 5 fire damage. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in the zone, enemies take a -2 penalty to attack rolls and all defenses.
    Level 11: 7 fire damage.
    Level 21: 10 fire damage.

Traitor's Brand.name: Traitor's Brand
Traitor's Brand.flavor: The fiendish brand on your chest flares, causing your enemy to lash out.
Traitor's Brand.trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you hits you.
Traitor's Brand.effect: Creatures adjacent to the triggering enemy take 1d6 fire damage.
Traitor's Brand.infernalPact: This power deals extra fire damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Shielding Hellfire.name: Shielding Hellfire
Shielding Hellfire.flavor: Flames flicker into life around you, drinking in the darkness and blessing your graceful movements.
