Shielding Hellfire.effect: You enter the shielding hellfire stance. Until the stance ends, whenever you have any concealment, you gain a +4 power bonus to Stealth checks and resist 5 fire. If you already have fire resistance, increase that resistance by 5.
Shielding Hellfire.infernalPact: Whenever your Warlock’s Curse is triggered, you gain a +4 power bonus to damage rolls with fire attack powers until the end of your next turn.

Pit Fiend Harbinger.name: Pit Fiend Harbinger
Pit Fiend Harbinger.flavor: Glorious pain rips through you as your skin blackens and hardens into devilish scales and great black wings, a crown of fire wreathing your brow.
Pit Fiend Harbinger.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC, a fly speed equal to your speed, and fire resistance equal to 5 + your level (if you already have fire resistance, increase it by 5). While this effect persists, you cannot spend healing surges, and you must make an attack on your turn each round or take damage equal to your level at the end of your turn. This damage cannot be prevented or reduced in any way.
Pit Fiend Harbinger.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.
Pit Fiend Harbinger.infernalPact: You gain 10 temporary hit points each time you sustain this power.

Spellscar Empowerment.name: Spellscar Empowerment
Spellscar Empowerment.flavor: You unlock your hidden power, blue flames surrounding you as you lash out.
Spellscar Empowerment.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack.
Spellscar Empowerment.effect: The enemy you hit is dazed until the end of your next turn. You take damage equal to 5 + one-half your level.

Plague Disruption.name: Plague Disruption
Plague Disruption.flavor: You release the Spellplague within, and your enemies are overwhelmed by the chaotic rush of power you control.
Plague Disruption.effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Enemies in the aura take a -2 penalty to attack rolls, and must roll twice and use the lower result when attempting to recharge a power.

Torture Reality.name: Torture Reality
Torture Reality.flavor: Your enemy’s strike wavers, changing course toward a target of your choosing.
Torture Reality.trigger: You are targeted by a melee or a ranged attack.
Torture Reality.effect: You redirect the attack to another creature adjacent to you, other than the attacker.

Morphic Recovery.name: Morphic Recovery
Morphic Recovery.flavor: You absorb some of the essence of another to wield as if it were your own.
Morphic Recovery.trigger: You hit an enemy granting combat advantage to you when you have expended all your encounter attack powers.
Morphic Recovery.effect: You recover one of your previously expended encounter attack powers of level 7 or lower.

Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe Spy).name: Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe Spy)
Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe Spy).flavor: Calling on the magic inherent in your bloodline, you rise into the air as lightly as a feather on the wind.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You can fly up to 4 squares vertically and 1 square horizontally, and hover there until the end of your next turn. You have an altitude limit of 4, but if some effect causes you to exceed this limit, you immediately descend to 4 squares above the ground after resolving the effect. When this flight ends, you descend to the ground, taking no falling damage.
Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe Spy).effect: You can fly up to 4 squares vertically and 1 square horizontally, and hover there until the end of your next turn. You have an altitude limit of 4, but if some effect causes you to exceed this limit, you immediately descend to 4 squares above the ground after resolving the effect. When this flight ends, you descend to the ground, taking no falling damage.

Continuous Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe S.name: Continuous Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe Spy)
Continuous Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe S.flavor: With focused concentration, you keep yourself aloft to gain the advantage over your foes.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You use levitation.

Effect: You gain the ability to sustain levitation. This ability lasts until the end of the encounter.

Sustain Move: Levitation persists until the end of your next turn, and you can move up to 3 squares vertically or 1 square horizontally.
Continuous Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe S.effect: You gain the ability to sustain levitation. This ability lasts until the end of the encounter.
Continuous Levitation (Bregan D'aerthe S.sustainMove: Levitation persists until the end of your next turn, and you can move up to 3 squares vertically or 1 square horizontally.

Sudden Stealth.name: Sudden Stealth
Sudden Stealth.flavor: The moment a threat reveals itself, your instinct for stealth takes over, letting you vanish from sight.
Sudden Stealth.trigger: You have any cover or concealment when you roll initiative.
Sudden Stealth.effect: You can make a Stealth check to hide.

Fluid Steps.name: Fluid Steps
Fluid Steps.flavor: You concentrate on the dance of combat, making certain that you stay a few steps ahead.
Fluid Steps.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can shift up to 3 squares as a move action.

Spy Sight.name: Spy Sight
Spy Sight.flavor: You focus your senses, letting all that would obscure the world slip away.
Spy Sight.effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to Insight checks and Perception checks until the end of the encounter.

Iron Wolf Charge.name: Iron Wolf Charge
Iron Wolf Charge.flavor: You scream out an unnerving howl as you charge into battle. Faint-hearted foes shrink from your savage wrath.
Iron Wolf Charge.trigger: You hit an enemy with a charge attack.
Iron Wolf Charge.effect:
That enemy takes 1d6 extra damage from the triggering attack, and you make the following attack.
    Level 11: 2d6 extra damage.
    Level 21: 3d6 extra damage.
Iron Wolf Charge.onHit: You push the target up to 2 squares. The target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Savage Effort.name: Savage Effort
Savage Effort.flavor: Refusing to be defeated, you press on in a test of endurance or athletic prowess that would defeat softer, more civilized people.
Savage Effort.effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever you make an Athletics check or an Endurance check, you can roll twice and use either result.

Wolf's Rend.name: Wolf's Rend
Wolf's Rend.flavor: You trip your foe, then follow up with a quick strike against it.
Wolf's Rend.effect: If you hit with both the primary and the secondary attack, you can shift up to 2 squares after the attacks.

Iron Wolf's Rend.name: Iron Wolf's Rend
Iron Wolf's Rend.flavor: You trip your foe, then follow up with a quick strike against it.
Iron Wolf's Rend.effect: If you hit with both the primary and the secondary attack, you can shift up to 3 squares after the attacks.

Epic Iron Wolf's Rend.name: Epic Iron Wolf's Rend
Epic Iron Wolf's Rend.flavor: You trip your foe, then follow up with a quick strike against it.
Epic Iron Wolf's Rend.effect: If you hit with both the primary and the secondary attack, you can shift up to 4 squares after the attacks.

Savage Tenacity.name: Savage Tenacity
Savage Tenacity.flavor: When your enemy tries to get away from you, you press it harder and increase your efforts.
Savage Tenacity.trigger: An enemy adjacent to you shifts 1 square.
Savage Tenacity.effect: You shift 1 square to a square adjacent to that enemy. You also gain a +2 power bonus to your next attack roll against that enemy until the end of your next turn.

Wolf's Bound.name: Wolf's Bound
Wolf's Bound.flavor: You strike a foe and pull it to the ground, then bound toward another enemy, letting loose a snarl as you attack.
Wolf's Bound.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack.
Wolf's Bound.effect: You knock the primary target prone and shift up to 3 squares. Then make the secondary attack.
Wolf's Bound.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Wolf's Bound.onHit: 2[W] damage. You push the secondary target up to 2 squares, and it takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Iron Wolf's Bound.name: Iron Wolf's Bound
Iron Wolf's Bound.flavor: You strike a foe and pull it to the ground, then bound toward another enemy, letting loose a snarl as you attack.
Iron Wolf's Bound.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack.
Iron Wolf's Bound.effect: You knock the primary target prone and shift up to 4 squares. Then make the secondary attack.
Iron Wolf's Bound.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Iron Wolf's Bound.onHit: 3[W] damage. You push the secondary target up to 3 squares, and it takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Epic Iron Wolf's Bound.name: Epic Iron Wolf's Bound
Epic Iron Wolf's Bound.flavor: You strike a foe and pull it to the ground, then bound toward another enemy, letting loose a snarl as you attack.
Epic Iron Wolf's Bound.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack.
Epic Iron Wolf's Bound.effect: You knock the primary target prone and shift up to 5 squares. Then make the secondary attack.
Epic Iron Wolf's Bound.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Epic Iron Wolf's Bound.onHit: 4[W] damage. You push the secondary target up to 4 squares, and it takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Savage Resurgence.name: Savage Resurgence
Savage Resurgence.flavor: The pain of your wounds drives you to fight even harder.
Savage Resurgence.trigger: An enemy bloodies you or scores a critical hit against you.
Savage Resurgence.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your highest ability modifier. Until you have no temporary hit points left, you gain a +2 power bonus to melee attack rolls.

Essence of Death.name: Essence of Death
Essence of Death.flavor: You call upon your inborn talent to drain the life from a foe, though it comes at a cost.
Essence of Death.trigger: You hit a creature adjacent to you with an attack.
Essence of Death.effect:
You take 1d6 necrotic damage, and the target takes 1d12 extra necrotic damage from the attack.
    Level 11: You take 2d6 necrotic damage, and the target takes 2d12.
    Level 21: You take 3d6 necrotic damage, and the target takes 3d12.

Dark Focus.name: Dark Focus
Dark Focus.flavor: You gain clarity through a dark understanding of life.
Dark Focus.trigger: You make a d20 roll and dislike the result.
Dark Focus.effect: You lose a healing surge and reroll the triggering roll. You must use the second result.

Shadow Vision.name: Shadow Vision
Shadow Vision.flavor: Your eyes see that which was previously hidden.
Shadow Vision.effect: You gain darkvision until the end of your next turn.

Dread Blessing.name: Dread Blessing
Dread Blessing.flavor: You sacrifice your essence to overcome a friend’s adversity.
Dread Blessing.trigger: One ally within 5 squares of you misses with an attack roll or fails a saving throw.
Dread Blessing.effect: You lose a healing surge, and the ally rerolls the triggering roll with a +4 power bonus and must use the second result. If the new result is a miss or a failed saving throw, this power is not expended.

Strike from the Shadows.name: Strike from the Shadows
Strike from the Shadows.flavor: You quickly dart from a hidden position and deal a debilitating blow.
Strike from the Shadows.trigger: When using a melee or ranged weapon attack power, you hit a creature that is granting combat advantage to you.
Strike from the Shadows.effect: The creature is weakened until the end of your next turn, and you can shift up to 2 squares.

Jibber Feint.name: Jibber Feint
Jibber Feint.flavor: You can talk your way out of any situation, temporarily lowering the defenses of your opponent.
Jibber Feint.effect: The next creature to attack the target before the end of your next turn gains combat advantage for that attack.

Ghostwalker.name: Ghostwalker
Ghostwalker.flavor: You leave the temporal for but a moment, only to return to the flesh.
Ghostwalker.effect: You are insubstantial until the start of your next turn, and you fly up to your speed.

Noble's Decree.name: Noble's Decree
Noble's Decree.trigger: You make a Diplomacy check or an Intimidate check.
Noble's Decree.effect: You gain a power bonus to this skill check equal to your Charisma modifier.

Seize Fate.name: Seize Fate
Seize Fate.flavor: You seize one opportunity, then another.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must have fewer than two Fortune Cards in your hand.

Effect: Draw two cards from your Fortune Card deck. Put one of those cards into your hand, and discard the other.
Seize Fate.requirement: You must have fewer than two Fortune Cards in your hand.
Seize Fate.effect: Draw two cards from your Fortune Card deck. Put one of those cards into your hand, and discard the other.

Flowing Fortune.name: Flowing Fortune
Flowing Fortune.flavor: You read the flow of fate, creating a decisive advantage for your allies.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Requirement: You must discard a Fortune Card.

Target: Each ally in the burst

Effect: If the card you discarded was an Attack card, each target gains a +4 power bonus to the next damage roll he or she makes before the end of your next turn. If it was a Tactics card, you slide each target up to 2 squares. If it was a Defense card, each target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.
Flowing Fortune.requirement: You must discard a Fortune Card.
Flowing Fortune.effect: If the card you discarded was an Attack card, each target gains a +4 power bonus to the next damage roll he or she makes before the end of your next turn. If it was a Tactics card, you slide each target up to 2 squares. If it was a Defense card, each target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Desperate Chance.name: Desperate Chance
Desperate Chance.flavor: Fortune smiles broadly on you in troubled times.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must have expended all your encounter attack powers.

Effect: Draw three cards from your Fortune Card deck. Until the end of the encounter, you can have up to three Fortune Cards in your hand. You can still play only one in a round, but you can draw a card at the start of your turn if your hand contains fewer than three cards.
Desperate Chance.requirement: You must have expended all your encounter attack powers.
Desperate Chance.effect: Draw three cards from your Fortune Card deck. Until the end of the encounter, you can have up to three Fortune Cards in your hand. You can still play only one in a round, but you can draw a card at the start of your turn if your hand contains fewer than three cards.

Low Blow.name: Low Blow
Low Blow.flavor: At the opportune moment, you hit your foe where it counts.
Low Blow.trigger: Your melee attack hits a creature granting combat advantage to you.
Low Blow.effect: The creature is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Size 'em Up.name: Size 'em Up
Size 'em Up.flavor: After hundreds of battles, you’ ve learned get a quick instinctive read on any enemy
Size 'em Up.prerequisite: You must have training in Insight.
Size 'em Up.effect: Choose a creature within 10 squares of you. You learn which of that creature’s defenses is highest and which is lowest, as well as its current and maximum hit points.

Hit and Withdraw.name: Hit and Withdraw
Hit and Withdraw.flavor: You rush in and strike, only to disappear before your enemy knows what hit it.
Hit and Withdraw.trigger: You hit with a melee attack.
Hit and Withdraw.effect: After the attack is resolved, you shift up to half your speed as a free action. If you are adjacent to a creature after this move and not adjacent to the target of your attack, you gain partial concealment until the end of your next turn.

Last Full Measure.name: Last Full Measure
Last Full Measure.flavor: Spurning caution, you throw yourself in front of the attack meant for your friend, who is inspired by your valor.
Last Full Measure.trigger: An enemy hits your ally with a melee or a ranged attack while the ally is adjacent to you.
Last Full Measure.effect: The attack hits you instead of your ally, and the ally gains temporary hit points equal to 2 + one-half your level.

Wild Guidance.name: Wild Guidance
Wild Guidance.flavor: You swiftly guide your companions through the rough ground ahead.
Wild Guidance.effect: You activate an aura 3 that lasts until the end of the encounter. While the aura is active, you can shift 2 squares as a move action. In addition, when any ally of yours starts his or her turn in the aura, that ally can shift up to 2 squares as a move action during that turn.

Hunter's Focus.name: Hunter's Focus
Hunter's Focus.flavor: Serene concentration descends upon you. You focus like an eagle on the most distant and minute details of your enemy’s defenses, and then spring the attack.
Hunter's Focus.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to Perception checks and a +2 power bonus to ranged attack rolls. In addition, you ignore the penalty for using ranged weapons at long range, and your ranged attacks ignore partial cover and partial concealment.

Springheel.name: Springheel
Springheel.flavor: Stepping lightly, you dance over terrain on which others can only stumble, leaving enemies slashing at empty air in your wake.
Springheel.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you ignore difficult terrain, and you do not provoke opportunity attacks by moving.

Heal Fey Beast Companion.name: Heal Fey Beast Companion
Heal Fey Beast Companion.flavor: You focus briefly on your bond with your fey beast companion, restoring some of its vitality.
Heal Fey Beast Companion.effect: The target regains a number of hit points equal to your healing surge value.

Safe Banishment.name: Safe Banishment
Safe Banishment.flavor: With a wave of your hand, your fey beast companion vanishes.
Safe Banishment.effect: Your fey beast companion is removed from play. It travels to a safe location in the Feywild. As a move action, you can recall your fey beast companion, and it appears in an unoccupied square adjacent to you.

Companion Form.name: Companion Form
Companion Form.flavor: Your body shifts and changes, and suddenly you take on a form that is nearly a mirror image of your fey beast companion.
Companion Form.effect: You assume a form similar to that of your fey beast companion. While in this form, you have the same aura as your companion. You gain the creature’s senses and speed, but the form does not otherwise alter your game statistics. The form lasts until the end of the encounter, until you end it as a minor action, or until you use any other power.

Summon Sidhe Ally.name: Summon Sidhe Ally
Summon Sidhe Ally.flavor: You summon an ally of your noble house, bound to obey you.
Summon Sidhe Ally.effect:
You summon a Sidhe house guard in an unoccupied space within range. The guard is an ally to you and your allies.
    The guard lacks actions of its own. Instead, you spend actions to command it mentally, choosing from the actions in the guard’s description. You must have line of effect to the guard to command it. When you command the guard, you and the guard share knowledge but not senses. If you use a move action to move yourself, you can also command the guard to move up to its speed.
    When the guard makes an attack roll or a check, you make the roll using your statistics, not including any temporary bonuses or penalties.
    The guard lasts until it drops below 1 hit point, at which point you lose a healing surge (or hit points equal to your surge value if you have no surges left). Otherwise, the guard lasts until you dismiss it as a minor action or until you use this power again.

Sidhe Bargain.name: Sidhe Bargain
Sidhe Bargain.flavor: You offer a bargain to one of your allies: a little more speed now in exchange for some of the ally’s extra effort later.
Sidhe Bargain.effect: The target can lose an action point to immediately take a standard action as a free action. If the target does so, you gain an action point.

Unified Front.name: Unified Front
Unified Front.flavor: You move to a better position from which to fight, and you and your guard present a dangerous front to your enemies.
Unified Front.effect: You and your Sidhe house guard can both move up to your respective speeds + 2. If you end this movement adjacent to your guard, you and it both gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value.

Temporary Fey Pact.name: Temporary Fey Pact
Temporary Fey Pact.flavor: You forge a pact similar to those of warlocks, giving some power to an ally and drawing on that ally’s vitality in return.
Temporary Fey Pact.effect: You enter into a pact with the target that lasts until you take a minor action to end it or until you use this power again. Once per encounter, while this pact is active, the target can take a minor action to cause you to lose the use of one encounter power or daily power of your choice that has a level. When the target does so, he or she regains the use of one of his or her expended powers of the same usage, type, and level. For example, if you lost the use of a 2nd-level encounter utility power, the target could regain the use of a 2nd-level encounter utility power. In addition, you can spend the target’s healing surges as if they were your own, if the target allows it.

Faerie Fortune.name: Faerie Fortune
Faerie Fortune.flavor: The magic of the Feywild flows from within you, causing the chaos of natural life to reorder itself to your benefit.
Faerie Fortune.effect: At the start of the encounter, roll a d20. Once before the end of the encounter, instead of rolling a d20, you can use this d20 roll as your result.

Tuathan Animal Shape.name: Tuathan Animal Shape
Tuathan Animal Shape.flavor: Your body shifts in an instant, taking the shape of a tiny animal such as a cat, a hare, or a rat.
Tuathan Animal Shape.effect:
You change from your humanoid form to the form of a Tiny nonflying fey or natural beast (such as a fox, a cat, or a raccoon) or vice versa. While you are in this beast form, you can make Stealth checks to hide using any cover or concealment, including cover from your allies, and you take no penalty to Stealth checks for moving up to your speed. You cannot make attacks or use item powers.
    Your equipment becomes part of this form, and you continue to gain the benefits of the equipment you wear, except a shield. Your ability to communicate is not inhibited, and you can make skill checks only if they don’t require you to be in humanoid form.
Tuathan Animal Shape.special: You can use this power only once per round.

Bargain of Truth.name: Bargain of Truth
Bargain of Truth.flavor: Clasping hands, drawing blood, or placing marks on a scroll of magic parchment, you seal a mystical pact with another creature to speak no lies.
Bargain of Truth.target: One willing creature in the burst
Bargain of Truth.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you and the target must speak truthfully to each other. Whenever either target knowingly lies to the other, the listener knows it, and the liar is restrained and weakened (save ends both).

Set Determination.name: Set Determination
Set Determination.flavor: You set your sights on the most powerful foe and swear an oath that you will bring it down.
Set Determination.effect: You mark the target until the end of your next turn. Until the mark ends, whenever you hit the target with an attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to 3 + your highest ability score modifier.
Set Determination.sustainMinor: The mark persists until the end of your next turn.

Faerie Warding Charm.name: Faerie Warding Charm
Faerie Warding Charm.flavor: Your fey charm compels others to obey your will. With a steady gaze or a commanding gesture, you turn your foe’s attack.
Faerie Warding Charm.trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you targets you with a melee or a ranged attack.
Faerie Warding Charm.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Faerie Warding Charm.effect: The target must choose a creature other than you to attack. If none of the target’s other enemies are in range, it must attack one of its allies in range. If no other creatures are in range, this power is expended with no effect, and the target attacks you.

Timeless Step.name: Timeless Step
Timeless Step.flavor: You move effortlessly within the timeless eternity of the Feywild, your motions swift and deadly, while your enemies seem to crawl ponderously through time and space.
Timeless Step.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Your melee weapon attacks and ranged weapon attacks against enemies in the aura gain the brutal 2 weapon property (against those enemies, reroll any weapon damage die that shows 1 or 2). In addition, any enemy that starts its turn in the aura is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Timeless Step.sustainMinor: The aura persists until the end of your next turn.
Timeless Step.special: You can use this power during an extended rest. If you do so, you require only 4 hours to gain the benefits of an extended rest.

Create Shadow-Wrought Weapon.name: Create Shadow-Wrought Weapon
Create Shadow-Wrought Weapon.flavor: You call forth the weapon given you by your master, a weapon that is cold to the touch no matter the temperature of its surroundings.
Create Shadow-Wrought Weapon.requirement: You must have a hand free.
Create Shadow-Wrought Weapon.effect:
You call to your hand a shadow-wrought weapon that lasts until you dismiss it as a free action or until you use this power again. The weapon has a +1 enhancement bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls, and it deals 1d8 extra damage on a critical hit.
    Level 6: +2 enhancement bonus, 2d8 extra damage.
    Level 11: +3 enhancement bonus, 3d8 extra damage.
    Level 16: +4 enhancement bonus, 4d8 extra damage.
    Level 21: +5 enhancement bonus, 5d8 extra damage.
    Level 26: +6 enhancement bonus, and 6d8 extra damage.

Unseelie Eyes.name: Unseelie Eyes
Unseelie Eyes.flavor: Your eyes take on a golden sheen, and suddenly you can see in the darkness as though it were daylight.
Unseelie Eyes.effect: You gain darkvision until the end of the encounter. Additionally, as a free action, you can cause your eyes to glow, shedding bright light in a 2-square radius. You can end the glow effect as a free action.

Shadow Cloak.name: Shadow Cloak
Shadow Cloak.flavor: You wrap the shadows around you, just as your master taught you.
Shadow Cloak.effect: You become invisible until the end of the encounter, until you move, or until you attack.

Umbral Report.name: Umbral Report
Umbral Report.flavor: You whisper words into a nearby shadow, and the darkness carries them away to the person you designate.
Umbral Report.effect:
You whisper a message of up to twenty-five words into a shadow, then choose a creature you know on your plane. (If the creature is your patron, the message is received regardless of planar location.) Only that creature hears the message. If the creature is not on your plane, the message is lost, and you are aware that the message was not received.
    If the creature receives the message, it can respond within 5 minutes with a similar shadow message of up to twenty-five words. Doing so requires a standard action.

Cold Shadow Strike.name: Cold Shadow Strike
Cold Shadow Strike.flavor: The chill in your shadow-wrought weapon deepens so that it seems to sap heat from anything that touches it.
Cold Shadow Strike.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack or a ranged attack using your shadow-wrought weapon.
Cold Shadow Strike.effect: The enemy takes 1d10 extra cold and necrotic damage, and it is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Unleash Corruption.name: Unleash Corruption
Unleash Corruption.flavor: Through force of will, you tap into the dark magic that was used to create your shadow-wrought weapon, unleashing its corruption.
Unleash Corruption.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack or a ranged attack using your shadow-wrought weapon.
Unleash Corruption.effect: The enemy takes ongoing 10 cold and necrotic damage (save ends).

Steppe-Horse Spirit.name: Steppe-Horse Spirit
Steppe-Horse Spirit.flavor: You draw deeply upon your tie to the land and leap into motion, avoiding retaliation with your first steps and moving with ease despite hindrances.
Steppe-Horse Spirit.effect: You move up to your speed, ignoring difficult terrain and suffering no negative effects for squeezing. If you are mounted, you can instead grant your mount this power’s effect.

Breath of Teylas.name: Breath of Teylas
Breath of Teylas.flavor: The wind is knocked out of you, but the breath of Teylas sustains you and carries you to safety.
Breath of Teylas.trigger: An enemy bloodies you or scores a critical hit against you.
Breath of Teylas.effect: You spend a healing surge and regain a number of additional hit points equal to your highest ability modifier. Then, shift up to half your speed. If you are mounted, your mount also regains a number of hit points equal to your highest ability modifier, and it can shift instead of you.

Hooves of Etugen.name: Hooves of Etugen
Hooves of Etugen.flavor: Earth spirits return control of your movement to you when an enemy tries to push you around.
Hooves of Etugen.trigger: You or a mount you are riding is subjected to forced movement or knocked prone.
Hooves of Etugen.effect: Neither you nor your mount is forcibly moved or knocked prone. Instead, you or your mount can shift up to the number of squares you would have been moved forcibly.

Sky Arrows.name: Sky Arrows
Sky Arrows.flavor: With a whispered homage to the storm spirits, you loose a ranged attack that rumbles with thunder.
Sky Arrows.trigger: You hit an enemy with an at-will ranged attack.
Sky Arrows.effect: The enemy takes 1d8 extra thunder damage from the attack.

Storm Arrows.name: Storm Arrows
Storm Arrows.flavor: Calling upon the storm spirits, you send forth an attack imbued with thunder or lightning.
Storm Arrows.trigger: You hit an enemy with an at-will ranged attack.
Storm Arrows.effect: The enemy takes 2d8 extra thunder damage or 2d8 extra lightning damage from the attack.

Tempest Arrows.name: Tempest Arrows
Tempest Arrows.flavor: Thunder accompanies the crackle of lightning as you call upon the spirits of the storm to strike your foe.
Tempest Arrows.trigger: You hit an enemy with an at-will ranged attack.
Tempest Arrows.effect: The enemy takes 3d8 extra thunder and lightning damage from the attack.

Sohei Flurry.name: Sohei Flurry
Sohei Flurry.flavor: The blood you’ ve drawn spurs you on, and you lash at other enemies around you with divinely inspired fury.
Sohei Flurry.requirement: You must have hit an enemy with a weapon attack during this turn.

Sohei Parry.name: Sohei Parry
Sohei Parry.flavor: Divine guidance helps you place your weapon in the path of an attack.
Sohei Parry.trigger: You are hit by a melee or ranged attack while you are holding a weapon.
Sohei Parry.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to the defense targeted by the attack until the end of your next turn.

Sohei Clarity.name: Sohei Clarity
Sohei Clarity.flavor: Your mind instinctively finds its center, ridding you of a hindrance to the performance of your duty.
Sohei Clarity.trigger: You start your turn subjected to a dominating or stunning effect that a save can end.
Sohei Clarity.effect: You make a saving throw against the effect.

Sohei Invincibility.name: Sohei Invincibility
Sohei Invincibility.flavor: Your conscious mind can no longer be relied upon, so your sense of self retreats to your innermost soul and keeps acting.
Sohei Invincibility.trigger: You start your turn dominated, stunned, or unconscious and have at least 1 hit point.
Sohei Invincibility.effect: You ignore the triggering condition and are instead dazed for the same duration as the triggering condition.

Sohei Advance.name: Sohei Advance
Sohei Advance.flavor: Centering yourself as you move, you draw your weapon and rush to engage your enemies.
Sohei Advance.effect: You can draw a weapon before making the attack.
Sohei Advance.special: When charging, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack. If you have actions remaining, you can use your sohei flurry power after the charge, but if you do, you grant combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Sohei Rush.name: Sohei Rush
Sohei Rush.flavor: You attack without consideration for your own safety, trusting in the power of the divine to see you through the fight.
Sohei Rush.effect: You can draw a weapon before making the attack.
Sohei Rush.special: When charging, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack. If you have actions remaining, you can use your sohei flurry power after the charge, but if you do, you grant combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Sohei Supremacy.name: Sohei Supremacy
Sohei Supremacy.flavor: More than one foe faces your attack, which you bring to bear with a swiftness granted by unshakable focus and the power of faith.
Sohei Supremacy.effect: You can draw a weapon before making the attack.
Sohei Supremacy.special: When charging, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack. If you have actions remaining, you can use your sohei flurry power after the charge, but if you do, you grant combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Master's Eye.name: Master's Eye
Master's Eye.flavor: Your obsequious call draws attention to your deeds, risking your master’s ire if you fail.
Master's Eye.effect:
If you make an attack this turn and hit with your first attack roll, the creature you hit takes 1d8 extra damage from that attack, and you gain 5 temporary hit points.
    If the attack roll misses, or if you do not attack this turn, you grant combat advantage and are deafened until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 10 temporary hit points.
    Level 21: 15 temporary hit points.

Mad Confidence.name: Mad Confidence
Mad Confidence.flavor: Your master is with you. You cannot fail.
Mad Confidence.effect: You enter the mad confidence stance. Until the stance ends, you grant combat advantage and gain a +4 power bonus to damage rolls.

Ritual Sacrifice.name: Ritual Sacrifice
Ritual Sacrifice.flavor: By offering your latest victim to the dark master, you are rewarded with a surge of power.
Ritual Sacrifice.effect:
Choose one of the following effects:
        You spend a healing surge.
        You gain a +1 power bonus to attack rolls until the end of the encounter.
        You gain a +5 power bonus to Arcana checks, Dungeoneering checks, Nature checks, and Religion checks until the start of your next extended rest.

Reluctant Sacrifice.name: Reluctant Sacrifice
Reluctant Sacrifice.flavor: Shared pain transforms near failure into a resounding success.
Reluctant Sacrifice.trigger: You make an attack roll and dislike the result.
Reluctant Sacrifice.effect: You and the target each take damage equal to your level. You then reroll the attack roll with a +2 power bonus and must use the second result.

Dirty Deed.name: Dirty Deed
Dirty Deed.flavor: Seizing an opening, you shove a distracted enemy and send it sprawling, just as an ally strikes.
Dirty Deed.target: One creature granting combat advantage to you
Dirty Deed.attack:
Highest ability modifier + 3 vs. Reflex
    Level 11: Highest ability modifier + 5
    Level 21: Highest ability modifier + 7
Dirty Deed.effect: One ally of yours adjacent to the target can make a melee basic attack against the target as a free action.

Disgraceful Retreat.name: Disgraceful Retreat
Disgraceful Retreat.flavor: An ally’s fall makes clear that withdrawal is the better part of valor.
Disgraceful Retreat.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you falls unconscious.
Disgraceful Retreat.effect: You can shift 1 square and then move up to your speed + 2. You must end the move farther from your ally than you were when you began the move.

Unabashed Treachery.name: Unabashed Treachery
Unabashed Treachery.flavor: A quick step and a slight push places an ally in the path of harm intended for you.
Unabashed Treachery.trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee or a ranged attack.
Unabashed Treachery.effect: The triggering attack hits the target instead of you. The triggering enemy grants you and the target combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Regrettable Sacrifice.name: Regrettable Sacrifice
Regrettable Sacrifice.flavor: With little more than a rueful pause, you undermine an ally to reinvigorate yourself.
Regrettable Sacrifice.effect: The target loses a healing surge. If the target can’t lose a surge, he or she takes damage equal to his or her healing surge value. You then regain hit points equal to your healing surge value.

Hellfire Touch.name: Hellfire Touch
Hellfire Touch.flavor: Clinging, searing blackness drawn from the Nine Hells erupts from your hand.
Hellfire Touch.effect:
The next creature you hit with an attack before the end of this turn takes 5 extra fire and necrotic damage from that attack. Also, you slide that creature up to 5 squares. If you do not hit a creature with an attack before the end of the turn, you take 5 fire and necrotic damage.
    Level 11: You deal or take 10 fire and necrotic damage.
    Level 21: You deal or take 15 fire and necrotic damage.

Wicked Temptation.name: Wicked Temptation
Wicked Temptation.flavor: A fiery rune appears over your target’s head, tempting all who see it to destroy the object of your scorn.
Wicked Temptation.target: One creature you can see in the burst
Wicked Temptation.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the first creature to hit the target gains temporary hit points equal to 3 + one-half your level, and the first creature to miss the target takes 1d10 fire damage.

Hellfire Step.name: Hellfire Step
Hellfire Step.flavor: Greasy black clouds conceal your escape, filling the air with a sulfurous stench.
Hellfire Step.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is lightly obscured, and creatures have vulnerable 5 fire while in it. You also teleport up to 5 squares.

Soul Snatcher.name: Soul Snatcher
Soul Snatcher.flavor: You consign the soul of a living foe to the Nine Hells and are rewarded for your dark deed.
Soul Snatcher.effect:
Choose one of the following effects:
        You spend a healing surge.
        You regain the use of an expended encounter attack power.

Vicious Assault.name: Vicious Assault
Vicious Assault.flavor: Building on the savagery of your initial assault, you lash out in all directions.
Vicious Assault.trigger: You hit an adjacent enemy with a melee weapon attack.
Vicious Assault.effect: Each creature other than you that is adjacent to the enemy takes 1[W] damage. In addition, you and each enemy within 2 squares of you grant combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Driven to Kill.name: Driven to Kill
Driven to Kill.flavor: One kill is never enough. Before your foe hits the ground, you leap to make the next attack.
Driven to Kill.trigger: You drop a creature below 1 hit point.
Driven to Kill.effect: You shift up to a number of squares equal to your speed + 2.

Killing Menace.name: Killing Menace
Killing Menace.flavor: An enemy’s success incenses you. Your rising anger infects your enemies with dread, making them susceptible to injury.
Killing Menace.trigger: An attack bloodies you or damages you while you’re bloodied.
Killing Menace.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of the encounter. Creatures in the aura have vulnerable 3 to weapon attacks.

Pain Preserves.name: Pain Preserves
Pain Preserves.flavor: Pain clarifies your thoughts and purpose, rendering your mind nearly impervious to bewilderment.
Pain Preserves.trigger: You are bloodied and start your turn subjected to an effect that is dazing, dominating, or stunning you.
Pain Preserves.effect: The triggering effect ends. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls.

Dark Speech.name: Dark Speech
Dark Speech.flavor: Your Abyssal curse assaults a victim, rending body and mind with its profanity.
Dark Speech.target: One creature that can hear you
Dark Speech.attack: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma vs. Fortitude, Reflex, and Will. You make a single attack roll and use it against each defense.
Dark Speech.onHit (Reflex): The target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Dark Speech.onHit (Will): You push the target up to its speed.

Corrupt the Flesh.name: Corrupt the Flesh
Corrupt the Flesh.flavor: At your insistence, an ally screams in agony, then twists into the perfect killing machine.
Corrupt the Flesh.effect: The target assumes the flesh warp stance. Until the stance ends, the target gains a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and a +4 power bonus to damage rolls, but is slowed and grants combat advantage.

Shadow of the Abyss.name: Shadow of the Abyss
Shadow of the Abyss.flavor: Your swift and subtle gesture calls a fiend from the Abyss to infest an ally, lending its protection against elemental energy.
Shadow of the Abyss.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.
Shadow of the Abyss.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Shadow of the Abyss.effect: The target gains resist 10 to the triggering damage type (or types) until the end of your next turn. Each creature adjacent to the target takes 5 damage of the same type.

Vile Undoing.name: Vile Undoing
Vile Undoing.flavor: Your wicked curse turns a foe’s reliable defense into its greatest weakness.
Vile Undoing.trigger: You hit an enemy that has resistance to your attack’s damage type.
Vile Undoing.effect: The enemy loses the resistance and gains vulnerability in its place (save ends both). The vulnerability equals the lost resistance.

Iaijutsu.name: Iaijutsu
Iaijutsu.flavor: While others contemplate, you act, loyal and resolute even in the face of death.
Iaijutsu.effect:
You can draw a weapon and shift up to a number of squares equal to half your speed. If you end this move adjacent to an enemy, you gain a +2 power bonus to the next attack roll you make against that enemy before the end of your next turn.
    If your initiative is higher than every enemy’s initiative, any melee weapon attack you make during your first turn of the encounter can score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

Honorable Resolve.name: Honorable Resolve
Honorable Resolve.flavor: In the service of your master you know no fear, no weakness, and no surrender.
Honorable Resolve.trigger: You are bloodied by an attack or damaged by an attack while bloodied.
Honorable Resolve.effect: You can use your second wind. Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +5 power bonus to saving throws against charm and fear effects, and enemy attacks never treat you as being bloodied.

Dauntless Gaze.name: Dauntless Gaze
Dauntless Gaze.flavor: You level an unwavering glare, projecting your focus with such intensity that your opponent is shaken to the core.
Dauntless Gaze.requirement: You must have training in Intimidate.
Dauntless Gaze.trigger: An enemy within 3 squares of you moves willingly.
Dauntless Gaze.effect: The target is marked by you and grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Riddle of Steel.name: Riddle of Steel
Riddle of Steel.flavor: In your hands, weapon and warrior are united in spirit, as your mind empties of the battlefield’s distractions.
Riddle of Steel.requirement: You must be holding a melee weapon.
Riddle of Steel.effect: You can make a saving throw. Also, until the end of your next turn, you gain a power bonus to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will equal to the highest enhancement bonus of a melee weapon you are holding.

Ruthless Demonstration.name: Ruthless Demonstration
Ruthless Demonstration.flavor: The sight of blood and your threatening presence fill your opponents with dread, making them think twice before attacking you.
Ruthless Demonstration.trigger: You bloody an enemy adjacent to you or reduce an enemy adjacent to you to 0 hit points or fewer.
Ruthless Demonstration.effect: Enemies that can see you take a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until you are hit by an attack or until the end of the encounter. Also, if you bloodied the triggering enemy, you can immediately make an Intimidate check against it to force it to surrender.

Life’s Losing Hand.name: Life’s Losing Hand
Life’s Losing Hand.flavor: Though fate has dealt you the hand of a misfit, you take loss and turn it into success.
Life’s Losing Hand.trigger: You roll a natural 1, 2, or 3 on an attack roll or a skill check.
Life’s Losing Hand.effect: You can reroll the attack roll or skill check, with a power bonus equal to your Charisma modifier. You must keep the second result, even if it is lower.

You Can’t Hide.name: You Can’t Hide
You Can’t Hide.flavor: No matter if your enemy tries to get away or stands and fights, it learns that either decision was a bad one.
You Can’t Hide.effect: If the target ends its next turn in a square that is not adjacent to you, you can shift up to your speed to a square adjacent to it as a free action. If the target attacks you during its next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to damage rolls against the target until the end of your next turn.

Underworld Vendetta.name: Underworld Vendetta
Underworld Vendetta.flavor: Your opponent’s insult will not go unpunished, as the overwhelming intensity of your counterattack promises certain death.
Underworld Vendetta.trigger: You or an ally is bloodied by an attack made by an enemy within 5 squares of you.
Underworld Vendetta.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Underworld Vendetta.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target grants combat advantage, and whenever you hit the target with an attack, it takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Wild Hunt Leap.name: Wild Hunt Leap
Wild Hunt Leap.flavor: Like the spear-wielding hunter leaping to strike, you soar through the air with ease to catch your quarry off guard.
Wild Hunt Leap.effect: You jump up to a number of squares equal to your speed. If you end this jump adjacent to an enemy, you gain combat advantage for the next attack you make against that enemy before the end of your next turn.

Moonfire Aura.name: Moonfire Aura
Moonfire Aura.flavor: Pale white light falls upon you, revealing those who would hide from your wrath.
Moonfire Aura.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of the encounter or until you end it as a minor action. Creatures in the aura cannot benefit from invisibility or any concealment.

Relentless Pursuit.name: Relentless Pursuit
Relentless Pursuit.flavor: Your prey flees! Instinctually, you manifest a small fragment of the Wild Hunt’s magic and cut off your foe’s escape.
Relentless Pursuit.trigger: An enemy that started its turn within 10 squares of you ends its turn farther away.
Relentless Pursuit.effect: You teleport to a square adjacent to the triggering enemy. You don’t need to have line of sight for this teleportation.

Gaze of the Evil Eye.name: Gaze of the Evil Eye
Gaze of the Evil Eye.flavor: Your foe feels the foreboding stare of your evil eye warning it away from you.
Gaze of the Evil Eye.target: One creature you can see that isn’t marked by you
Gaze of the Evil Eye.effect:
The target takes 2 psychic damage whenever it hits you with an attack (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). The effect ends if you don’t have line of sight to the target at the end of your turn, or if you use this power against a different target.
    Level 21: 4 psychic damage.

Eye of the Fomorians.name: Eye of the Fomorians
Eye of the Fomorians.flavor: Your eye changes color, and your vision becomes suddenly more acute. All is made clear.
Eye of the Fomorians.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to Perception checks and can see invisible creatures.

Urge of Destiny.name: Urge of Destiny
Urge of Destiny.flavor: The eye sees violence in the near future. Its bloodlust fills your ally, making the carnage even more glorious.
Urge of Destiny.effect: The target deals 1d6 extra damage until the end of the encounter, or 2d6 extra damage to creatures marking it.

Evil Eye Mesmerism.name: Evil Eye Mesmerism
Evil Eye Mesmerism.flavor: A foe decides you don’t deserve harm. Only later does it realize that your eye had made it believe you weren’t its enemy.
Evil Eye Mesmerism.trigger: An enemy within 10 squares of you misses you with an attack.
Evil Eye Mesmerism.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Evil Eye Mesmerism.effect: The target can’t attack you until the end of its next turn.

Sarifal Advisor.name: Sarifal Advisor
Sarifal Advisor.flavor: A faint popping noise accompanies the appearance of the tiny fey you summon to aid you.
Sarifal Advisor.effect:
You summon a Sarifal advisor in an unoccupied square within range. The creature is an ally to you and your allies.
    The advisor lacks actions of its own. Instead, you spend actions to command it mentally, choosing from the actions in its description. You must have line of effect to the advisor to command it. When you command the advisor, the two of you share knowledge but not senses.
    When the advisor makes a check, you make the roll using your game statistics, not including temporary bonuses or penalties.
    The advisor lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, at which point you lose a healing surge (or hit points equal to your healing surge value if you have no surges left). Otherwise, it lasts until you dismiss it as a minor action or until the end of the encounter.

Light of Sarifal.name: Light of Sarifal
Light of Sarifal.flavor: Light emanates from you so intensely that your enemies cannot bear to ignore you.
Light of Sarifal.effect: You activate an aura 3 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Enemies in the aura take a penalty to damage rolls against creatures other than you. The penalty equals your highest ability modifier.
Light of Sarifal.sustainMinor: The aura persists until the end of your next turn.

Dragoon Warding.name: Dragoon Warding
Dragoon Warding.flavor: You vow to protect an ally, creating a spiritual tie between you and shielding the ally from the worst of any assault.
Dragoon Warding.effect: The target gains a +2 power bonus to AC and Fortitude. Whenever the target is adjacent to you and takes damage from a melee or ranged attack, you can take half the damage, halving the damage the target takes. Nothing can reduce the damage you take. These effects last until the end of your next turn.

Dragoon Parry.name: Dragoon Parry
Dragoon Parry.flavor: Subtle changes in the enemy’s bearing reveal its intentions, allowing you to parry and throw the foe off balance.
Dragoon Parry.trigger: An adjacent enemy hits you with a melee attack while you are wielding a melee weapon.
Dragoon Parry.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex against the triggering attack. In addition, you gain combat advantage against the triggering enemy until the end of your next turn.

Dragoon Summons.name: Dragoon Summons
Dragoon Summons.flavor: You howl the ancient battle cry of Ffolk warriors and the wind gains a sudden chill, followed by the ghostly arrival of an ancestral defender.
Dragoon Summons.effect:
You summon an ancestral defender in an unoccupied square within range. The creature is an ally to you and your allies.
    The defender lacks actions of its own. Instead, you spend actions to command it mentally, choosing from the actions in its description. You must have line of effect to the defender to command it. When you command the defender, the two of you share knowledge but not senses.
    When the defender makes a check, you make the roll using your game statistics, not including temporary bonuses or penalties.
    The defender lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, at which point you lose a healing surge (or hit points equal to your healing surge value if you have no surges left). Otherwise, it lasts until you dismiss it as a minor action or until the end of the encounter.

Sarifal's Blessing.name: Sarifal's Blessing
Sarifal's Blessing.flavor: You call for and receive a boon that shields you from harm and weakens your enemies.
Sarifal's Blessing.effect:
Choose cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or thunder. You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in the aura, you and your allies gain resist 5 to the chosen damage type. Any enemy in the aura has vulnerable 5 to your attacks that deal the chosen damage type.
    Level 11: The resistance and vulnerability increase to 10.
    Level 21: The resistance and vulnerability increase to 15.

Flee Peril.name: Flee Peril
Flee Peril.flavor: When the enemy gains the upper hand, you waste no time making good your escape.
Flee Peril.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you is hit by an attack.
Flee Peril.effect: You shift up to half your speed.

Surprising Betrayal.name: Surprising Betrayal
Surprising Betrayal.flavor: You shove a nearby ally into an attack’s path so that you can slip away unscathed.
Surprising Betrayal.trigger: A creature hits or misses you with a melee or a ranged attack.
Surprising Betrayal.effect: You and the target swap positions (the target slides 1 square, and you shift 1 square). The target is hit or missed by the attack, instead of you.

Duplicitous Evasion.name: Duplicitous Evasion
Duplicitous Evasion.flavor: You duck behind another creature to escape an attack, leaving it to fend for itself.
Duplicitous Evasion.trigger: An enemy makes a melee or a ranged attack against you while you are adjacent to at least one other creature.
Duplicitous Evasion.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses against the triggering attack. If the attack misses you, you can swap positions with an adjacent creature other than the triggering enemy (the creature slides 1 square, and you shift 1 square), and the enemy repeats the attack against that creature.

Treacherous Advantage.name: Treacherous Advantage
Treacherous Advantage.flavor: Shoving an ally into danger creates a distraction so that you can move into an advantageous position.
Treacherous Advantage.effect: You push the primary target up to 2 squares, and he or she grants combat advantage until the start of your next turn. You then shift up to half your speed and make the secondary attack.
Treacherous Advantage.secondaryOnHit:
2[W] + your highest ability modifier damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 3[W] + your highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 4[W] + your highest ability modifier damage.

Hellfire Heart.name: Hellfire Heart
Hellfire Heart.flavor: You bolster an attack with roiling hellfire, drawing upon your infernal heritage to burn and terrify your foe.
Hellfire Heart.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack.
Hellfire Heart.effect:
The enemy takes fire damage equal to 1 + your highest ability modifier. Until the start of your next turn, the enemy takes a -2 penalty to the attack rolls of attacks that include you as a target.
    Level 11: 3 + your highest ability modifier fire damage.
    Level 21: 5 + your highest ability modifier fire damage.

Devil’s Due.name: Devil’s Due
Devil’s Due.flavor: You offer vital aid to your companion—at a very fair price.
Devil’s Due.trigger: You grant an ally a power bonus or enable him or her to spend a healing surge.
Devil’s Due.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of the encounter, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value. The ally’s healing surge value is then reduced by one-half your level until the end of the encounter.

Liar’s Lure.name: Liar’s Lure
Liar’s Lure.flavor: Your silver tongue and flawless feints create lethal opportunities for you and your allies.
Liar’s Lure.effect: Make a single Bluff check and compare it to the passive Insight of each target. If your Bluff check exceeds a target’s passive Insight, that target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Infernal Inheritor.name: Infernal Inheritor
Infernal Inheritor.flavor: You allow the devil within to emerge, temporarily transforming you into a font of infernal power.
Infernal Inheritor.effect: All enemies that can see you take a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn, and you assume the form of the infernal inheritor until the end of the encounter. Until this form ends, you gain darkvision, resist 10 fire, and a +2 power bonus to Fortitude and Will.

Demonic Frenzy.name: Demonic Frenzy
Demonic Frenzy.flavor: When your anger breaks free, your claws and teeth lengthen and you can’t stop yourself from lashing out.
Demonic Frenzy.trigger: You hit with a melee attack on your turn.
Demonic Frenzy.target: One randomly determined creature adjacent to you
Demonic Frenzy.effect:
The target takes 1d6 damage.
    Level 11: 2d6 damage.
    Level 21: 3d6 damage.

Abyssal Eyes.name: Abyssal Eyes
Abyssal Eyes.flavor: Your eyes give off a sinister gleam that enables you to see in the dark and unnerve your enemies.
Abyssal Eyes.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you have darkvision. In addition, whenever you make a melee attack against a bloodied enemy, you have combat advantage against that enemy.

Demonic Ferocity.name: Demonic Ferocity
Demonic Ferocity.flavor: Surrendering to your demonic heritage fills you with dreadful viciousness.
Demonic Ferocity.trigger: You make an attack roll and miss.
Demonic Ferocity.effect: You reroll the attack roll and can use either result. Until the end of your next turn, your allies provoke opportunity attacks from you. You must make every opportunity attack you can.

Abyssal Doom.name: Abyssal Doom
Abyssal Doom.flavor: The brutality of your attack instills a similar lust for blood in every creature near you.
Abyssal Doom.trigger: You reduce a creature to 0 hit points on your turn.
Abyssal Doom.target: You and each creature in the burst
Abyssal Doom.effect: Until the end of your next turn, each target grants combat advantage and deals 1d8 extra damage with melee attacks.

Stone Panoply.name: Stone Panoply
Stone Panoply.flavor: By striking the ground, you bring forth a shower of rock and dirt that besets those near you and armors you in a stony shell.
Stone Panoply.requirement: You must be on the ground.
Stone Panoply.onHit:
1[W] + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 11: 2[W] + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3[W] + highest ability modifier damage.
Stone Panoply.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you are slowed and you gain resistance to all damage equal to 1 + one-half your level.

Earthforger’s Might.name: Earthforger’s Might
Earthforger’s Might.flavor: You draw power from the stones beneath you to increase your physical might.
Earthforger’s Might.requirement: You must be on the ground.
Earthforger’s Might.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, or until you are no longer on the ground, you gain a +2 power bonus to melee damage rolls and Strength checks.
    Level 11: +4 power bonus.
    Level 21: +6 power bonus.

Earthforger’s Passage.name: Earthforger’s Passage
Earthforger’s Passage.flavor: Whether dirt or stone, rubble or debris, earth moves to accommodate your passage.
Earthforger’s Passage.effect: You move up to your speed. During this movement, you have earth walk, and you can move through earth or stone as if you had phasing.

Tremor Step.name: Tremor Step
Tremor Step.flavor: The earth trembles around you, making footing treacherous for your foes and infusing allies with refreshing earth energy.
Tremor Step.requirement: You must be on the ground.
Tremor Step.effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you are no longer on the ground. The ground in the aura is difficult terrain for enemies that lack earth walk.
Tremor Step.sustainMinor: The aura persists until the end of your next turn, and you or one ally in the aura gains temporary hit points equal to one-half your level.

Disciplined Counter.name: Disciplined Counter
Disciplined Counter.flavor: An enemy’s miss allows you to rebalance the flow of energy by making an instant counterattack.
Disciplined Counter.trigger: An adjacent enemy misses you with a melee attack.
Disciplined Counter.onHit:
1[W] damage, and you slide the target up to 2 squares. The target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 2[W] damage.
    Level 21: 3[W] damage.

Balancing Step.name: Balancing Step
Balancing Step.flavor: The elemental balance within you allows you to move carefully and with perfect grace.
Balancing Step.effect: You shift up to 3 squares, ignoring difficult terrain. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses, and climbing or balancing doesn’t cause you to grant combat advantage.

Restoring Touch.name: Restoring Touch
Restoring Touch.flavor: Your knowledge of the body’s natural energy flow allows you to heal minor injuries with a few skillful touches.
Restoring Touch.effect: The target can spend a healing surge and regain 1d6 additional hit points. The target can also end one poison, dazing, or stunning effect currently affecting it.

Flowing Defense.name: Flowing Defense
Flowing Defense.flavor: You adopt a shifting stance that allows you to move easily while guarding yourself and nearby friends.
Flowing Defense.effect: You assume the flowing defense stance. Until the stance ends, you can shift 1 square as a minor action. Further, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses. Your allies gain the same bonus while adjacent to you.

Blazing Corona.name: Blazing Corona
Blazing Corona.flavor: Fire erupts from your body, burning until you fling it away from you as a fiery bolt.
Blazing Corona.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura takes fire damage equal to your highest ability modifier. Using the secondary power ends the aura.
Blazing Corona.requirement: The power Blazing Corona must be active in order to use this power.
Blazing Corona.attack:
Highest ability modifier + 2 vs. Reflex
    Level 11: Highest ability modifier + 4
    Level 21: Highest ability modifier + 6
Blazing Corona.onHit:
1d8 fire damage.
    Level 11: 2d8 fire damage.
    Level 21: 3d8 fire damage.

Lesser Produce Flame.name: Lesser Produce Flame
Lesser Produce Flame.flavor: Snapping your fingers causes a fiery ball to appear in your hand to illuminate your surroundings.
Lesser Produce Flame.effect: You create a flame in your hand that emits bright light out to 10 squares. The flame lasts until the end of the encounter, until you dismiss it as a minor action, or until you use the secondary power.
Lesser Produce Flame.requirement: The power Lesser Produce Flame must be active in order to use this power.
Lesser Produce Flame.attack: Highest ability modifier vs. Reflex. You gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.

Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
Produce Flame.flavor: Snapping your fingers causes a fiery ball to appear in your hand to illuminate your surroundings.
Produce Flame.effect: You create a flame in your hand that emits bright light out to 10 squares. The flame lasts until the end of the encounter, until you dismiss it as a minor action, or until you use the secondary power.
Produce Flame.requirement: The power Produce Flame must be active in order to use this power.
Produce Flame.attack: Highest ability modifier vs. Reflex. You gain a +4 bonus to the attack roll.

Greater Produce Flame.name: Greater Produce Flame
Greater Produce Flame.flavor: Snapping your fingers causes a fiery ball to appear in your hand to illuminate your surroundings.
Greater Produce Flame.effect: You create a flame in your hand that emits bright light out to 10 squares. The flame lasts until the end of the encounter, until you dismiss it as a minor action, or until you use the secondary power.
Greater Produce Flame.attack: Highest ability modifier vs. Reflex. You gain a +6 bonus to the attack roll.

Lesser Roaring Flames.name: Lesser Roaring Flames
Lesser Roaring Flames.flavor: A bright and loud cascade of fire singes your foes while inspiring your allies.
Lesser Roaring Flames.attack: Highest ability modifier vs. Reflex. You gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.
Lesser Roaring Flames.effect: Each ally in the burst gains a +2 power bonus to one attack roll, saving throw, or skill or ability check made before the start of your next turn.

Roaring Flames.name: Roaring Flames
Roaring Flames.flavor: A bright and loud cascade of fire singes your foes while inspiring your allies.
Roaring Flames.attack: Highest ability modifier vs. Reflex. You gain a +4 bonus to the attack roll.
Roaring Flames.effect: Each ally in the burst gains a +2 power bonus to one attack roll, saving throw, or skill or ability check made before the start of your next turn.

Greater Roaring Flames.name: Greater Roaring Flames
Greater Roaring Flames.flavor: A bright and loud cascade of fire singes your foes while inspiring your allies.
Greater Roaring Flames.attack: Highest ability modifier vs. Reflex. You gain a +6 bonus to the attack roll.
Greater Roaring Flames.effect: Each ally in the burst gains a +2 power bonus to one attack roll, saving throw, or skill or ability check made before the start of your next turn.

Burning Bright.name: Burning Bright
Burning Bright.flavor: Your presence causes fires to burn so hot that little hope exists of extinguishing them.
Burning Bright.effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of the encounter. Enemies in the aura have vulnerable 5 fire and take a -2 penalty to saving throws against ongoing fire damage. Nonmagical fires in the aura can be put out only if you allow them to be extinguished.

Inevitable Strike.name: Inevitable Strike
Inevitable Strike.flavor: Elemental power flows through you, providing you with keen accuracy and sharper striking force.
Inevitable Strike.trigger: You make a melee weapon attack roll.
Inevitable Strike.effect:
Make the attack roll twice. If both attack rolls hit, the target takes 1d8 extra damage.
    Level 11: 2d8 extra damage.
    Level 21: 3d8 extra damage.

Steely Resolve.name: Steely Resolve
Steely Resolve.flavor: You recover from a solid blow as if your enemy had struck metal rather than flesh.
Steely Resolve.trigger: You are bloodied by an attack.
Steely Resolve.effect: You can spend a healing surge. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Fortitude.

Ironwrought Toughness.name: Ironwrought Toughness
Ironwrought Toughness.flavor: Embracing your elemental power gives your flesh the durability of iron.
Ironwrought Toughness.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you have resistance to all damage equal to the amount that your ironwrought level 5 feature normally grants. While you are bloodied, this resistance increases by 2.

Weapon Unity.name: Weapon Unity
Weapon Unity.flavor: Your essence flows into your weapon so that you and it are one.
Weapon Unity.effect: You assume the weapon unity stance. Until the stance ends, your melee weapon attacks can score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20. You also gain a +2 power bonus to opportunity attack rolls.

Janissary Charge.name: Janissary Charge
Janissary Charge.flavor: You hurl yourself into battle, threatening your enemy and preventing it from moving easily.
Janissary Charge.effect:
You gain 5 temporary hit points, and then you charge an enemy. If your charge attack hits, the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 10 temporary hit points.
    Level 21: 15 temporary hit points.

Janissary’s Shield.name: Janissary’s Shield
Janissary’s Shield.flavor: You call upon elemental force and shape it around you to protect nearby allies from attack.
Janissary’s Shield.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Allies in the aura gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses. Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. While in the aura, you and your allies have resist 5 to that damage type.

Janissary’s Mist Form.name: Janissary’s Mist Form
Janissary’s Mist Form.flavor: You briefly transform yourself into mist, dust, or ash, giving you the ability to pass over or through obstacles.
Janissary’s Mist Form.effect: You assume mist form. While in this form, you are insubstantial, and you gain a fly speed or swim speed (choose one) equal to your speed. You cannot attack while in this form, but you can move at full speed while squeezing and do not grant combat advantage for squeezing. The form lasts until the end of your next turn or until you to end it as a minor action.

Janissary Zeal.name: Janissary Zeal
Janissary Zeal.flavor: You invoke elemental power to renew your vigor and strength.
Janissary Zeal.effect: You can spend a healing surge, and you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

Summon Flame Zephyr.name: Summon Flame Zephyr
Summon Flame Zephyr.flavor: From the smallest spark, cinder, or candle flame, you command a minor elemental of air and fire to come forth.
Summon Flame Zephyr.effect:
You summon a flame zephyr in an unoccupied square in range. The creature is an ally to you and your allies.
    The zephyr lacks actions of its own. Instead, you spend actions to command it mentally, choosing from the actions in its description. You don’t need line of effect to the zephyr to command it. When you command the zephyr, the two of you share knowledge but not senses.
    When the zephyr makes a check, you make the roll using your game statistics, not including temporary bonuses or penalties.
    The flame zephyr lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, at which point you lose a healing surge (or hit points equal to your healing surge value if you have no surges left).
Otherwise, it lasts until you dismiss it as a minor action or until the end of the encounter.

Elemental Adaptation.name: Elemental Adaptation
Elemental Adaptation.flavor: You use minor elemental warding to adapt yourself to almost any hazardous environment.
Elemental Adaptation.effect: Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Until the end of the encounter, you gain resist 5 to that damage type and a +5 power bonus to Endurance checks.

Elemental Drudge.name: Elemental Drudge
Elemental Drudge.flavor: You call forth a minor elemental and dispatch it on an errand.
Elemental Drudge.effect: You conjure a minor elemental spirit that animates a Small mass of whatever element is available in an unoccupied square in range. This drudge persists until you dismiss it as a minor action, until it completes its task, or until 1 hour has elapsed. The drudge has speed 10 and a +0 bonus to ability checks required to perform its errand. It can travel up to 1 mile from you in the performance of its task. You can command the drudge to do any of the following errands.

Elemental Mine.name: Elemental Mine
Elemental Mine.flavor: You bottle raw chaos in a small area, creating a hazard that goes unseen until an enemy steps into it.
Elemental Mine.effect: The target square becomes a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter or until an enemy enters it. Without a Perception check (DC 10 + your level + your highest ability modifier), your enemies notice neither the zone nor your use of this power. When an enemy enters the zone, that enemy and each creature adjacent to the zone take 5 damage and fall prone.

Solkara’s Wave.name: Solkara’s Wave
Solkara’s Wave.flavor: You call forth an icy flood filled with the power of Solkara.
Solkara’s Wave.onHit:
1d8 + highest ability modifier cold damage, and you push the target up to 2 squares. The target is slowed and gains vulnerable 5 cold until the end of your next turn.
    Level 11: 2d8 + highest ability modifier cold damage.
    Level 21: 3d8 + highest ability modifier cold damage.

Vezzuvu’s Eruption.name: Vezzuvu’s Eruption
Vezzuvu’s Eruption.flavor: A small eruption knocks creatures down with rumbling tremors and sears them with hot ash.
keywords: Arcane, Elemental, Fire, Implement, Thunder, Zone
Vezzuvu’s Eruption.onHit:
1d6 + highest ability modifier thunder damage, and the target falls prone.
    Level 11: 2d6 + highest ability modifier thunder damage.
    Level 21: 3d6 + highest ability modifier thunder damage.
Vezzuvu’s Eruption.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that ends its turn in the zone takes 5 fire damage.

Solkara’s Grasp.name: Solkara’s Grasp
Solkara’s Grasp.flavor: You surround yourself with an aura that emulates the crushing pressure of the deeps.
Solkara’s Grasp.effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Each creature that starts its turn in the aura is slowed, gains vulnerable 5 cold, and takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the start of its next turn.
Solkara’s Grasp.sustainMinor: The aura persists until the end of your next turn.

Vezzuvu’s Tread.name: Vezzuvu’s Tread
Vezzuvu’s Tread.flavor: Ground by your feet grows soft and hot, like the boiling mud on a volcano’s flanks.
Vezzuvu’s Tread.effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn. The aura is difficult terrain for all creatures except you. Any enemy that ends its turn in the aura farther from you than where it started its turn, or that willingly leaves the aura, takes 5 fire damage.
Vezzuvu’s Tread.sustainMinor: The aura persists until the end of your next turn.

Solkara’s Forest.name: Solkara’s Forest
Solkara’s Forest.flavor: You call forth frigid water that quickly solidifies into slippery terrain and tree-like icicles.
Solkara’s Forest.effect:
The burst creates a zone of ice that lasts until the end of the encounter. The zone is difficult terrain for all creatures except you and creatures that have ice walk. Any creature that is pushed, pulled, or slid while in the zone can be moved 1 additional square by the forced movement.
    You also create up to three icicles, each in an unoccupied square in the burst. These icicles are blocking terrain. Any creature other than you that enters a square adjacent to an icicle, or ends its turn there, takes 5 cold damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Vezzuvu’s Armor.name: Vezzuvu’s Armor
Vezzuvu’s Armor.flavor: You gird yourself with crude armor made of volcanic rock.
Vezzuvu’s Armor.effect: You gain resist 5 fire and a +2 power bonus to AC and Fortitude. Any enemy that hits you with a melee attack takes 5 fire damage. These effects last until the end of your next turn.
Vezzuvu’s Armor.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Guardian Archons.name: Guardian Archons
Guardian Archons.flavor: You conjure minor elemental spirits to impede your foes.
Guardian Archons.effect: You conjure three elemental guardians, each in an unoccupied square in the burst. They remain until the end of your next turn. Enemies cannot enter the guardians’ spaces, but you and your allies can move through them. You can make opportunity attacks through each guardian as if you occupied its square.
Guardian Archons.moveAction: You move each guardian up to 3 squares.
Guardian Archons.sustainMinor: The guardians persist until the end of your next turn.

Buffeting Wave.name: Buffeting Wave
Buffeting Wave.flavor: At your command, a wall of water appears and crashes down.
Buffeting Wave.attack:
Highest ability modifier vs. Fortitude. You gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.
    Level 11: The bonus increases to +4.
    Level 21: The bonus increases to +6.
Buffeting Wave.onHit:
1d6 + highest ability modifier damage, and the target falls prone.
    Level 11: 2d6 + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3d6 + highest ability modifier damage.

Safe Harbor.name: Safe Harbor
Safe Harbor.flavor: Elemental water rinses away all hurts and provides shelter until your companion can recover.
Safe Harbor.effect: The target can spend a healing surge. Until the end of your next turn, the target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses, and squares adjacent to the target are difficult terrain for enemies.

Flowing Features.name: Flowing Features
Flowing Features.flavor: You cause the tissues in your body to reshape themselves into a form more to your liking.
Flowing Features.effect:
You alter your physical form to take on the appearance of any humanoid of your size. You retain your statistics in your new form, and your clothing, armor, and possessions do not change. You remain in your new form until you change form again or until you dismiss the form as a minor action.
    Any creature that attempts to see through your ruse makes an Insight check opposed by your Bluff check. You gain a +5 bonus to your check.

Sea of Unity.name: Sea of Unity
Sea of Unity.flavor: You create a profound link among you and your companions.
Sea of Unity.effect: You activate an aura 5 that lasts until the end of the encounter. You and each ally in the aura grant combat advantage for being flanked only if you and every ally in the aura are flanked. When one enemy in the aura grants combat advantage to you or an ally in the aura, that enemy grants combat advantage to you and each ally in the aura.

Wind Fury Assault.name: Wind Fury Assault
Wind Fury Assault.flavor: The wind carries you aloft, helping you deliver a punishing strike against a distant foe.
Wind Fury Assault.effect: You can fly up to your speed. At any point during this movement, you can make the following attack.
Wind Fury Assault.onHit:
1[W] + highest ability modifier damage, and you can slide the target 1 square.
    Level 11: 2[W] + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3[W] + highest ability modifier damage.

Protective Gale.name: Protective Gale
Protective Gale.flavor: The wind rises up in a shell around you, hindering your enemies and deflecting their projectiles.
Protective Gale.effect: You activate an aura 2 that lasts until the end of your next turn. The aura is difficult terrain for enemies. You and each ally in the aura gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex against ranged attacks.

Bend Light.name: Bend Light
Bend Light.flavor: Light seems to veer away from your target, and the creature abruptly vanishes.
Bend Light.effect: The target is invisible until the end of your next turn. If the target makes an attack, the invisibility ends.
Bend Light.sustainMinor: If the target is within 10 squares of you, the invisibility persists until the end of your next turn.

Wind Step.name: Wind Step
Wind Step.flavor: For a few moments, the wind carries and holds you and then places you safely down again.
Wind Step.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you have a fly speed of 8 and can hover. When this flight ends, you descend to the ground, taking no falling damage.

Focused Discipline.name: Focused Discipline
Focused Discipline.flavor: You call upon your training and adjust to the ebb and flow of battle, going on the offensive or falling back to defend yourself as the situation demands.
Focused Discipline.effect:
You enter the focused discipline stance. Until the stance ends, at the start of each of your turns you can choose one of the following benefits. The benefit lasts until the start of your next turn.
        Offense: You gain a +1 power bonus to melee basic attack rolls.
        Defense: Whenever you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack, one ally adjacent to you gains a +1 power bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.
        Tactics: After you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack, you can shift 1 square as a free action.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.flavor: Your enemy deflects your blow, and you notice a weakness that your allies can exploit.
Exploit Opening.trigger: You miss an enemy with a melee attack.
Exploit Opening.effect: The enemy grants combat advantage until the start of your next turn.

Sudden Formation.name: Sudden Formation
