Sudden Formation.flavor: As you bark a few short commands, your allies move into position.
Sudden Formation.effect: You move up to half your speed. Each target can then shift up to his or her speed to a square adjacent to you as a free action.

Unified Resilience.name: Unified Resilience
Unified Resilience.flavor: Using your knowledge of battle, you call out warnings to nearby allies, helping them to avoid solid blows.
Unified Resilience.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of the encounter. While in the aura, each ally who can hear you gains resistance to all damage equal to your highest ability modifier.

Defensive Casting.name: Defensive Casting
Defensive Casting.flavor: You use one of the secret incantations of the War Wizards to protect yourself when casting.
Defensive Casting.effect: Until the end of your next turn, your ranged and area arcane powers do not provoke opportunity attacks.

Irregular Dispersal.name: Irregular Dispersal
Irregular Dispersal.flavor: You control the energy of your spells to avoid hitting your friends.
Irregular Dispersal.effect: You take a -4 penalty to attack rolls against your allies until the end of your next turn.

Attuned Wards.name: Attuned Wards
Attuned Wards.flavor: You cover your nearby ally in an arcane cloak that offers protection from your attacks.
Attuned Wards.effect: The target takes no damage from your arcane attack powers until the end of your next turn.

Unleash Devastation.name: Unleash Devastation
Unleash Devastation.flavor: You channel all your strength into one furious attack.
Unleash Devastation.trigger: You roll damage for an arcane attack power and dislike the result.
Unleash Devastation.effect: You reroll as many of the damage dice as you like, but you must use the second result.

Marshal’s Interdiction.name: Marshal’s Interdiction
Marshal’s Interdiction.flavor: With a firm voice and a sure strike, you let your enemy know that it is subject to the full penalty of the law.
Marshal’s Interdiction.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack.
Marshal’s Interdiction.effect: The target is immobilized until the end of your next turn. You also mark the target until you end your turn without hitting or missing it with an attack. In addition, you designate the enemy as your marshal’s quarry until the end of the encounter.

Marshal’s Pursuit.name: Marshal’s Pursuit
Marshal’s Pursuit.flavor: When your target is in sight, you move quickly and with care.
Marshal’s Pursuit.effect:
You assume the marshal’s pursuit stance. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
     You gain a +2 power bonus to speed.
     You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against opportunity attacks that you provoke by moving.
     You can shift 1 square as a free action at the end of each of your turns, but this movement must place you closer to or the same distance from your marshal’s quarry.

Marshal’s Resolve.name: Marshal’s Resolve
Marshal’s Resolve.flavor: While pressing the assault, you prepare for whatever your enemy throws at you.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack.

Target: The enemy you hit

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the target. If the target is your marshal’s quarry, you also gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value.
Marshal’s Resolve.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack.
Marshal’s Resolve.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the target. If the target is your marshal’s quarry, you also gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value.

Marshal’s Triumph.name: Marshal’s Triumph
Marshal’s Triumph.flavor: Your success renews your resolve to bring justice to your foes.
Marshal’s Triumph.trigger: You reduce a nonminion enemy to 0 hit points.
Marshal’s Triumph.effect: You can spend a healing surge and make a saving throw against one effect that a save can end. If the enemy was your marshal’s quarry, you also regain the use of marshal’s interdiction.

Bound by Brass.name: Bound by Brass
Bound by Brass.flavor: While the mystic symbols on your skin burn bright, enemies dare not strike you for fear of drawing the ire of your master.
Bound by Brass.effect: Until the end of your next turn or until you attack, creatures of your level or lower cannot target you with melee attacks or ranged attacks.

Use Cinderspeech.name: Use Cinderspeech
Use Cinderspeech.flavor: You instill your words with primordial echoes that transcend simple language.
Use Cinderspeech.trigger: You would make a Diplomacy check or an Intimidate check.
Use Cinderspeech.effect: You instead make an Arcana check with a +2 power bonus. You are considered to share a language with the target of the check.

Me and This Army.name: Me and This Army
Me and This Army.flavor: You inform opponents that the adventurers wielding a legion’s worth of blades are, in fact, your comrades.
Me and This Army.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of the encounter. Each ally in the aura gains a +2 power bonus to Will. While the aura is active, you gain a +1 power bonus to Intimidate checks and Diplomacy checks for each ally in the aura (maximum +5).

Blazing Reprisal.name: Blazing Reprisal
Blazing Reprisal.flavor: Your foes reconsider interfering with you when they learn whom you call master.
Blazing Reprisal.trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you hits you with an attack.
Blazing Reprisal.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Blazing Reprisal.effect: The target rerolls the attack and must use the second result. If the attack still hits, the target takes fire damage equal to 5 + one-half your level after the attack is resolved.

Seed of Chaos.name: Seed of Chaos
Seed of Chaos.flavor: When extra effort is called for, your chaos-touched being cannot help but respond.
Seed of Chaos.trigger: You or an ally you can see spends an action point to make an attack.
Seed of Chaos.effect:
After the attack is resolved, roll a d6. The triggering character gains the resulting benefit.
1. The character gains a +2 power bonus to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
2. Until the end of your next turn, the target of the attack takes 2 extra damage each time it is bit with an attack.
3. The creature gains a +2 power bonus to speed until the end of your next turn.
4. Until the end of your next turn, the target of the attack grants combat advantage.
5. The character can make a basic attack as a free action.
6. Until the end of your next turn, the target of the attack cannot shift.

Foment Chaos.name: Foment Chaos
Foment Chaos.flavor: Siphoning off a piece of your soul, you unleash it to run wild in the world.
Foment Chaos.effect: You are weakened until the end of your first turn during this encounter, and you can use seed of chaos up to two additional times this encounter.

Command Chaos.name: Command Chaos
Command Chaos.flavor: You take command of your chaotic essence, wresting it into your desired shape. Chaos demands payment for such acts, though, and you are left drained for the effort.
Command Chaos.effect: You lose a healing surge, and you can select the result of your d6 roll.

Warp the World.name: Warp the World
Warp the World.flavor: Dissatisfied with the course of events, you draw upon your ability to reshape it to fit your whims.
Warp the World.trigger: A creature within 5 squares of you makes an attack roll or a skill check, and you dislike the result.
Warp the World.effect: Roll a d6. Use the result as a bonus or a penalty to the roll or check.

Storm the Deck.name: Storm the Deck
Storm the Deck.flavor: You charge a foe and send it stumbling over the nearest gunwale.
Storm the Deck.trigger: You hit a creature with a charge attack.
Storm the Deck.effect: You can push the creature 1 square. On a natural attack roll of 20, the creature also falls prone.

Storm Legs.name: Storm Legs
Storm Legs.flavor: You ride with the attack’s momentum, letting it carry you where you want to be.
Storm Legs.trigger: You are subjected to a push, a pull, or a slide from an attack.
Storm Legs.effect: You negate the forced movement against yourself, and you can shift 1 square. If you end the shift adjacent to an enemy, you gain a +2 power bonus to your next melee attack roll against that enemy.

Blitz Rush.name: Blitz Rush
Blitz Rush.flavor: You sprint into combat, twisting away from enemy blades with the vicious grace of a thunderbolt.
Blitz Rush.effect: You shift up to half your speed, ending the shift adjacent to an enemy. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex.

Blood and Thunder.name: Blood and Thunder
Blood and Thunder.flavor: Witnessing your injuries, nearby allies go mad with rage and rush the enemy.
Blood and Thunder.effect: Each target shifts up to half his or her speed as a free action, ending the shift closer to an enemy. Until the start of your next turn, each target is considered to be flanking an enemy as long as he or she and at least one ally are adjacent to that enemy.

Alter Time.name: Alter Time
Alter Time.flavor: You alter the flow of time around you, granting your allies a few crucial moments to reposition themselves.
Alter Time.effect: You move up to your speed. Any ally adjacent to you at the end of this movement can move up to his or her speed as a free action.

My Body, Myself!.name: My Body, Myself!
My Body, Myself!.flavor: You beat back the fog settling over your mind, determined to maintain control over your body.
My Body, Myself!.trigger: You are stunned or dominated by an attack while you have at least one healing surge remaining.
My Body, Myself!.effect: Instead of suffering the triggering effect, you lose a healing surge, and you are dazed (save ends).

A Skip in Time.name: A Skip in Time
A Skip in Time.flavor: You spend a little time now so that you’ ll have some breathing room in the future.
A Skip in Time.effect: You gain an extra move action, which you must use before the end of this turn.

Bend Time.name: Bend Time
Bend Time.flavor: A shimmering field wards you from help and harm alike. Hopefully, it will last long enough.
Bend Time.trigger: You are damaged by an attack.
Bend Time.effect: You take none of the damage now. You instead take it at the end of your next turn.

Create Lord’s Armor.name: Create Lord’s Armor
Create Lord’s Armor.flavor: You call forth armor of energy to protect you in your time of need.
Create Lord’s Armor.requirement: You must not be wearing armor, other than nonmagical clothing.
Create Lord’s Armor.effect:
Choose a type of armor with which you have proficiency. You instantly don +1 magic armor of that type. The armor lasts until you dismiss it as a minor action, until it is removed from you, or until you use this power again.
Level 6: +2 magic armor.
Level 11: +3 magic armor.
Level 16: +4 magic armor.
Level 21: +5 magic armor.
Level 26: +6 magic armor.

Prepared for the Worst.name: Prepared for the Worst
Prepared for the Worst.flavor: You react as though you were on your guard, even though you were taken by surprise.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are surprised at the start of an encounter while you are conscious.

Effect: You can take a single move or minor action on your turn during the surprise round.
Prepared for the Worst.trigger: You are surprised at the start of an encounter while you are conscious.
Prepared for the Worst.effect: You can take a single move or minor action on your turn during the surprise round.

Keys to the City.name: Keys to the City
Keys to the City.flavor: You say the right things to the right people, and everything falls into place.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a Diplomacy check.

Effect: Treat the result of the check as though you had rolled a natural 20.
Keys to the City.effect: Treat the result of the check as though you had rolled a natural 20.

No More Lies.name: No More Lies
No More Lies.flavor: You uncover the proof you need to convince the world you aren’t crazy.
No More Lies.trigger: You make an Intimidate check against a creature you can see.
No More Lies.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to the check. On a success, any polymorph or illusion effect on the creature is also suppressed until the end of your next turn, when the effect then resumes.

Bloodied Determination.name: Bloodied Determination
Bloodied Determination.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Bloodied Determination.flavor: When you are in dire straits, failure is not an option. You adjust your attack at the last moment to deliver a strike.
Bloodied Determination.trigger: You miss with an at-will attack power while you are bloodied.
Bloodied Determination.effect: You reroll the missed attack roll.

Forced Advantage.name: Forced Advantage
Forced Advantage.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Forced Advantage.flavor: You fix your attention on one opponent to the exclusion of all other foes.
Forced Advantage.target: One creature you can see in the burst
Forced Advantage.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain combat advantage against the target and a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the target’s attacks. You also take a -2 penalty to attack rolls on attacks that do not include the target.

Urgent Aggression.name: Urgent Aggression
Urgent Aggression.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Urgent Aggression.flavor: The enemies you face bring back memories of your loss and sorrow, feelings you use to push yourself beyond your normal limits.
Urgent Aggression.effect: You gain an extra move action during your first turn in the encounter.

To the Death.name: To the Death
To the Death.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
To the Death.flavor: You refuse death’s call and push yourself to keep fighting.
To the Death.effect: You use one of your at-will attack powers. If the attack reduces its target to 0 hit points or fewer, you can spend a healing surge.

Subterranean Survival.name: Subterranean Survival
Subterranean Survival.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Subterranean Survival.flavor: You thrive in the unforgiving caverns of the Underdark.
Subterranean Survival.trigger: You make a Dungeoneering check and dislike the result.

Up against the Wall.name: Up against the Wall
Up against the Wall.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Up against the Wall.flavor: You find ways to take advantage of close-quarters environments.
Up against the Wall.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain partial cover while you are adjacent to a square of blocking terrain, and any enemy that misses you with a melee attack while you have partial cover grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Cavern Lore.name: Cavern Lore
Cavern Lore.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Cavern Lore.flavor: Your talent for exploring caves gives you the edge needed to overcome unexpected challenges.
Cavern Lore.trigger: You fail an Acrobatics, Athletics, Endurance, or Perception check while underground.
Cavern Lore.effect: You make a Dungeoneering check and use its result instead.

Spelunker’s Instincts.name: Spelunker’s Instincts
Spelunker’s Instincts.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Spelunker’s Instincts.flavor: Your cave-delving reactions can save you from a sudden misstep or a serious injury.
Spelunker’s Instincts.trigger: You take damage from a trap, a hazard, or a fall.
Spelunker’s Instincts.effect:
Reduce the damage by 5 + one-half your level.
    Level 11: 10 + one-half your level.
    Level 21: 15 + one-half your level.

My Mind Is My Own.name: My Mind Is My Own
My Mind Is My Own.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
My Mind Is My Own.flavor: Your passion for freedom drives out the presence of insidious entities from your mind.
My Mind Is My Own.trigger: You are hit by a charm or a psychic attack.
My Mind Is My Own.effect: As above, and you can make a saving throw against any charm effect and psychic effect at the start of your turn, instead of at the end, if a save can end the effect. This benefit lasts until the end of the encounter.

Protective Trauma.name: Protective Trauma
Protective Trauma.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Protective Trauma.flavor: A hidden bit of memory has placed an accessible psionic defense in your mind.
Protective Trauma.effect: As above, and allies gain a +1 power bonus to Will while adjacent to you. This benefit lasts until the end of your next turn.

Alien Insight.name: Alien Insight
Alien Insight.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Alien Insight.flavor: A confusing barrage of sensations left over from your imprisonment flashes before your eyes, giving you an advantage if you can make sense of them.
Alien Insight.effect: As above, but roll twice and use either result.

Window into Madness.name: Window into Madness
Window into Madness.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Window into Madness.flavor: You make mental contact with your enemy, giving it a brief yet vivid taste of the torment you endured as a thrall.
Window into Madness.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you grant combat advantage, and the target gains vulnerable 10 psychic.
Window into Madness.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Trip the Trap.name: Trip the Trap
Trip the Trap.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Trip the Trap.flavor: An enemy’s approach triggers a nasty trap you prepared just for this occasion.
keywords:
Melee 1

Requirement: You must have a trap-making kit on your person.

Trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.

Target: The triggering enemy

Attack: Intelligence + 2 vs. Reflex
Trip the Trap.requirement: You must have a trap-making kit on your person.
Trip the Trap.trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.
Trip the Trap.attack:
Intelligence + 2 vs. Reflex
    Level 11: Intelligence + 4 vs. Reflex
    Level 21: Intelligence + 6 vs. Reflex
Trip the Trap.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier damage.
    Level 11: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier damage.
Trip the Trap.effect: The target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Alarm Trap.name: Alarm Trap
Alarm Trap.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Alarm Trap.flavor: A few specially enchanted bells can suss out a hidden foe.
Alarm Trap.requirement: You must have a trap-making kit on your person.
Alarm Trap.effect: You set an alarm trap in one unoccupied square adjacent to you. It lasts until the end of your next extended rest. If an invisible creature enters a square within 5 squares of the trap, the trap is destroyed, and the creature loses invisibility and takes a -10 penalty to Stealth checks (save ends both).

Disorienting Trap.name: Disorienting Trap
Disorienting Trap.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Disorienting Trap.flavor: You lay a magical trap designed to bewilder an enemy.
Disorienting Trap.requirement: You must have a trap-making kit on your person.
Disorienting Trap.effect: You set a disorienting trap in one unoccupied square adjacent to you. It lasts until the end of your next extended rest. If an enemy enters a square within 5 squares of the trap, the trap is destroyed, and the enemy and each creature adjacent to it grants combat advantage and falls prone if hit (save ends both).

It’s a Trap!.name: It’s a Trap!
It’s a Trap!.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
It’s a Trap!.flavor: You sense that something bad is about to happen.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Trigger: A hazard, object, or trap within 5 squares of you triggers.

Target: You and each ally in the burst

Effect: Each target shifts up to half his or her speed and gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses against hazards, objects, and traps until the end of the encounter.
It’s a Trap!.trigger: A hazard, object, or trap within 5 squares of you triggers.
It’s a Trap!.target: You and each ally in the burst
It’s a Trap!.effect: Each target shifts up to half his or her speed and gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses against hazards, objects, and traps until the end of the encounter.

Treasure Sense.name: Treasure Sense
Treasure Sense.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Treasure Sense.flavor: You have an innate sense of where treasure is located.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Choose a single item. For the next hour, you gain a +4 power bonus to any knowledge check, Perception check, Streetwise check, or Thievery check that relates to finding or identifying that item.
Treasure Sense.effect: Choose a single item. For the next hour, you gain a +4 power bonus to any knowledge check, Perception check, Streetwise check, or Thievery check that relates to finding or identifying that item.

Stick and Move.name: Stick and Move
Stick and Move.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Stick and Move.flavor: You take advantage of a chance to act freely.
Stick and Move.trigger: On your turn, you succeed on a Thievery check or hit an enemy with a basic attack.
Stick and Move.effect: You shift up to 2 squares, and you can draw or stow one item.

Pay Attention.name: Pay Attention
Pay Attention.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Pay Attention.flavor: Often, allies don’t look out for the dangers found in dungeons. Sometimes you need to remind them.
Pay Attention.target: You and each ally in the burst
Pay Attention.effect:
Each target gains a +2 power bonus to his or her initiative check, and a +2 power bonus to all defenses during the first round of combat.
    Level 11: +4 power bonus.
    Level 21: +6 power bonus.

Exertion.name: Exertion
Exertion.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Exertion.flavor: You know how to dig deep to meet a challenging situation.
Exertion.trigger: You make a skill check or a saving throw and dislike the result.
Exertion.effect: You reroll and must use the new result.

Insidious Commentary.name: Insidious Commentary
Insidious Commentary.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Insidious Commentary.flavor: Your words are disarming to a potential foe and give you just enough of an opportunity to make an effective attack.
Insidious Commentary.attack:
Charisma + 2 vs. Will
    Level 11: Charisma + 4 vs. Will
    Level 21: Charisma + 6 vs. Will
Insidious Commentary.onHit: The target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn, and your next attack against the target this turn deals 1d6 extra damage on a hit.

Practiced Herald.name: Practiced Herald
Practiced Herald.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Practiced Herald.flavor: You and your allies are not greeted with hostility, and thus you find a way to take advantage of a momentary lapse in your enemy’s defenses.
Practiced Herald.target: You and each ally in the burst
Practiced Herald.effect: Until the end of your next turn, each target gains a +1 power bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws.

Cloak and Dagger.name: Cloak and Dagger
Cloak and Dagger.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Cloak and Dagger.flavor: You vanish from the vision of those around you.
Cloak and Dagger.effect: You become invisible until the end of your next turn. If you attack, the effect ends, and if you move, you cannot sustain it.
Cloak and Dagger.sustainMinor: The invisibility persists until the end of your next turn.

Pacifying Presence.name: Pacifying Presence
Pacifying Presence.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Pacifying Presence.flavor: Your soothing tone lulls your enemies into hesitation.
Pacifying Presence.trigger: You and your enemies roll initiative.
Pacifying Presence.target: Each enemy that can hear and understand you in the burst
Pacifying Presence.effect: Each target takes a -10 penalty to its initiative check.

Alone and Unafraid.name: Alone and Unafraid
Alone and Unafraid.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Alone and Unafraid.flavor: Although you crave companionship, you have learned to survive without anyone at your side.
Alone and Unafraid.requirement: You must be at least 5 squares away from your allies.
Alone and Unafraid.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and all defenses.

Cast off Disgrace.name: Cast off Disgrace
Cast off Disgrace.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Cast off Disgrace.flavor: Though you shoulder the burden of failure, you promise yourself it won’t happen again.
Cast off Disgrace.trigger: You miss with an attack roll or fail a skill check or a saving throw.
Cast off Disgrace.effect: Before the end of your next turn, you can reroll a single attack roll, skill check, or saving throw, but not the triggering one. You must use the new result.

Self-Reliant.name: Self-Reliant
Self-Reliant.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Self-Reliant.flavor: Your ally gives a revitalizing healing effect to another, knowing that you are capable of fending for yourself.
Self-Reliant.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you is the target of a healing power that does not heal you.

Slink Away.name: Slink Away
Slink Away.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Slink Away.flavor: You skulk to safety just before your enemy uses a powerful area attack.
Slink Away.trigger: You are hit by a close or area attack.
Slink Away.effect: You shift up to your speed.

Bear Shape.name: Bear Shape
Bear Shape.flavor: Surrendering to the beast within causes you to shed your humanoid form and become a savage bear.
Bear Shape.effect:
You change from your humanoid form to a beast form—a bear—that lasts until the end of the encounter. Alternatively, you can end the form as a minor action and shift 1 square. While you are in beast form, you can’t use weapon or implement attack powers that lack the beast form keyword, although you can sustain such powers.
    While in this form, you have low-light vision. The form is your size, and it doesn’t otherwise change your game statistics or movement modes. Your equipment becomes part of the form, but you drop anything you are holding, except implements you can use. You continue to gain the benefits of the equipment you wear, except a shield.
    You can use the properties and the powers of implements as well as magic items you wear, but not the properties or the powers of weapons or the powers of wondrous items. While equipment is part of the form, it cannot be removed, and anything in a container that is part of your form is inaccessible.
    Until the form ends, you can use the secondary power at will.
Bear Shape.attack:
Highest ability modifier + 3 vs. AC
    Level 11: Highest ability modifier + 6
    Level 21: Highest ability modifier + 9
Bear Shape.onHit:
1d8 + highest ability modifier damage, and you mark the target until the start of your next turn.
    Level 21: 2d8 + highest ability modifier damage.
Bear Shape.special: You can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Bear Up.name: Bear Up
Bear Up.flavor: Your massive arms itch to wrap your enemy in a crushing embrace from which there is little hope of escape, and your wounds begin to close.
Bear Up.requirement: You must have started this turn bloodied.
Bear Up.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, when you hit with bear shape’s secondary power, you can grab the target until the end of your next turn. In addition, while you are bloodied and in beast form, you have regeneration 2.
    Level 11: Regeneration 4.
    Level 21: Regeneration 6.

Enraged Bear.name: Enraged Bear
Enraged Bear.flavor: Sudden pain shatters your control and you transform into a bear before your enemies’ eyes.
Enraged Bear.trigger: An attack hits you while you are not in your beast form.
Enraged Bear.effect: You use bear shape even if the power is already expended. Each enemy within 3 squares of you that can see you takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).

Blessing of the Great Bear.name: Blessing of the Great Bear
Blessing of the Great Bear.flavor: You call out to the Great Bear and feel nature’s magic flow through to aid an ally in need.
Blessing of the Great Bear.effect: You end one effect that a saving throw can end on the target.

Dire Rat Shape.name: Dire Rat Shape
Dire Rat Shape.flavor: By embracing your bestial nature, you undergo a disturbing transformation into a vicious dire rat.
Dire Rat Shape.effect:
You change from your humanoid form to a beast form—a dire rat—that lasts until the end of the encounter. Alternatively, you can end the form as a minor action and shift 1 square. While you are in beast form, you can’t use weapon or implement attack powers that lack the beast form keyword, although you can sustain such powers.
    While in this form, you have low-light vision. The form is Small, and it doesn’t otherwise change your game statistics or movement modes. Your equipment becomes part of the form, but you drop anything you are holding, except implements you can use. You continue to gain the benefits of the equipment you wear, except a shield.
    You can use the properties and the powers of implements as well as magic items you wear, but not the properties or the powers of weapons or the powers of wondrous items. While equipment is part of the form, it cannot be removed, and anything in a container that is part of your form is inaccessible.
    Until the form ends, you can use the secondary power at will.
Dire Rat Shape.attack:
Highest ability modifier + 3 vs. AC
    Level 11: Highest ability modifier + 6
    Level 21: Highest ability modifier + 9
Dire Rat Shape.onHit:
1d4 + highest ability modifier damage. If the target is granting you combat advantage, it also takes ongoing 5 damage (save ends).
    Level 21: 2d4 + highest ability modifier damage.
Dire Rat Shape.special: You can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Rat-Blooded.name: Rat-Blooded
Rat-Blooded.flavor: Your claws help you scramble up a vertical surface with ease, and your madly beating heart increases your vitality.
Rat-Blooded.requirement: You must have started this turn bloodied.
Rat-Blooded.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, you gain a climb speed equal to half your speed while you are in beast form. In addition, while you are bloodied and in beast form, you have regeneration 2.
    Level 11: Regeneration 4.
    Level 21: Regeneration 6.

Rat Scurry.name: Rat Scurry
Rat Scurry.flavor: You scurry between your enemies’ feet, slipping past their reach to get into position.

Wererat Feint.name: Wererat Feint
Wererat Feint.flavor: You catch your enemies by surprise when you shed your humanoid form to become a dire rat.
Wererat Feint.trigger: You use the dire rat shape power.
Wererat Feint.target: Each enemy that can see you in the burst
Wererat Feint.effect: The target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Wolf Shape.name: Wolf Shape
Wolf Shape.flavor: Loosing the beast within triggers a sudden, painful transformation into a menacing wolf.
Wolf Shape.effect:
You change from your humanoid form to a beast form—a wolf—that lasts until the end of the encounter. Alternatively, you can end the form as a minor action and shift 1 square. While you are in beast form, you can’t use weapon or implement attack powers that lack the beast form keyword, although you can sustain such powers.
    While in this form, you have low-light vision. The form is your size, and it doesn’t otherwise change your game statistics or movement modes. Your equipment becomes part of the form, but you drop anything you are holding, except implements you can use. You continue to gain the benefits of the equipment you wear, except a shield.
    You can use the properties and the powers of implements as well as magic items you wear, but not the properties or the powers of weapons or the powers of wondrous items. While equipment is part of the form, it cannot be removed, and anything in a container that is part of your form is inaccessible.
    Until the form ends, you can use the secondary power at will.
Wolf Shape.attack:
Highest ability modifier + 3 vs. AC
    Level 11: Highest ability modifier + 6
    Level 21: Highest ability modifier + 9
Wolf Shape.onHit:
1d10 + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 2d10 + highest ability modifier damage.
Wolf Shape.special: You can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Wolf's Vitality.name: Wolf's Vitality
Wolf's Vitality.flavor: Anger courses through your veins and lends a fierce strength to your legs.
Wolf's Vitality.requirement: You must have started this turn bloodied.
Wolf's Vitality.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, your speed increases by 1 while you are in beast form. In addition, while you are bloodied and in beast form, you have regeneration 2.
    Level 11: Regeneration 4.
    Level 21: Regeneration 6.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.flavor: Wolves fight better in packs, which you prove when you work with your allies.
Pack Attack.trigger: You hit an enemy with wolf shape’s secondary power, and the enemy is adjacent to at least one of your allies.
Pack Attack.effect: You also knock the enemy prone.

Werewolf Frenzy.name: Werewolf Frenzy
Werewolf Frenzy.flavor: Your pain drives you to madness, causing you to lash out at anything in your reach.
Werewolf Frenzy.trigger: While your wolf shape is active, an attack bloodies you, or you are hit while bloodied.
Werewolf Frenzy.effect: You assume the werewolf frenzy stance until you are no longer bloodied. While in this stance, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls, and your beast form attack powers deal 1d6 extra damage. Until your wolf shape ends, your allies provoke opportunity attacks from you, and you must make every opportunity attack that you can.

Sea Chantey.name: Sea Chantey
Sea Chantey.flavor: Your jolly song eases the burden of work or monotony among your comrades.
Sea Chantey.target: You and each ally in the burst
Sea Chantey.effect: Choose a skill. Until the end of the encounter, each target gains a +2 power bonus to checks made with that skill. In addition, if you use this power on board a ship, the ship’s speed increases by 2 for the next 8 hours.

Shifting Tides.name: Shifting Tides
Shifting Tides.flavor: You quickly pass through cramped surroundings as an enemy advances, using a tangle of ropes or other hampering objects to make the foe vulnerable to attack.
Shifting Tides.trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.
Shifting Tides.effect: You shift up to half your speed, ignoring difficult terrain. The first time you hit the triggering enemy before the end of your next turn, the enemy is immobilized (save ends).

Avast!.name: Avast!
Avast!.flavor: A stern command from you causes even the surliest sea dog to hold fast.
Avast!.effect: Each target can choose to be slowed until the end of your next turn. If a target does so, he or she gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses and can reduce forced movement against him or her by up to 2 squares while slowed by this effect.

Devious Strike.name: Devious Strike
Devious Strike.flavor: The Spider Queen blesses your stealthy attack.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You hit a creature granting combat advantage to you.

Effect: Your attack deals 5 extra damage, and you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and skill checks until the end of your next turn.
Devious Strike.trigger: You hit a creature granting combat advantage to you.
Devious Strike.effect: Your attack deals 5 extra damage, and you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and skill checks until the end of your next turn.

Obey Your Betters.name: Obey Your Betters
Obey Your Betters.flavor: You issue a command, enforced with an undisguised threat of painful death.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a Diplomacy check or an Intimidate check and dislike the result.

Effect: You reroll the check with a +4 bonus, and you can use either result.
Obey Your Betters.trigger: You make a Diplomacy check or an Intimidate check and dislike the result.
Obey Your Betters.effect: You reroll the check with a +4 bonus, and you can use either result.

Promise of Regret.name: Promise of Regret
Promise of Regret.flavor: You vow swift vengeance to the fool who dared strike you.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.

Effect: Until the end of the triggering enemy’s next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against that enemy’s attacks, and each of your attacks against that enemy can score a critical hit on a roll of 19–20.
Promise of Regret.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.
Promise of Regret.effect: Until the end of the triggering enemy’s next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against that enemy’s attacks, and each of your attacks against that enemy can score a critical hit on a roll of 19–20.

Deny Favor.name: Deny Favor
Deny Favor.flavor: As your foe strikes, you beseech Lolth to repay the insult with her divine curse.
Deny Favor.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.
Deny Favor.effect: Until the end of its next turn, the triggering enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls, grants combat advantage, cannot regain hit points, and cannot recharge powers.

Blood for Spiders.name: Blood for Spiders
Blood for Spiders.flavor: You accept a blood sacrifice from an ally.
Blood for Spiders.target: One ally adjacent to you or to your spiderling familiar
Blood for Spiders.effect: The target loses a healing surge, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the target’s healing surge value. If the target has no healing surges, the target instead takes damage equal to his or her surge value, and you gain the temporary hit points.

Demonweb Visage.name: Demonweb Visage
Demonweb Visage.flavor: Lolth’s wrath shapes your body momentarily into that of a spiderlike demon, and your enemies lose heart.
Demonweb Visage.effect: Until the start of your next turn, enemies cannot attack you or your spiderling familiar.

Yochlol Form.name: Yochlol Form
Yochlol Form.flavor: You call upon Lolth to grant you the yellow, gelatinous form of her handmaidens.
Yochlol Form.effect: You assume the form of a Medium yochlol until the end of the encounter. In this form, you gain a +2 power bonus to Will and your melee reach increases by 1. Until the end of the encounter, you can use a minor action to change between your normal form and your yochlol form.

Skullduggery.name: Skullduggery
Skullduggery.flavor: You knock a foe off guard, leaving an opening for you and your allies to exploit.
Skullduggery.effect: The target grants combat advantage until the end of your turn.

Uncertain Loyalties.name: Uncertain Loyalties
Uncertain Loyalties.flavor: You sow doubt in an opponent’s mind as to whether you are truly a friend or foe.
Uncertain Loyalties.effect: The target cannot attack you until the end of your next turn. This effect ends immediately if you attack the target.

Weapon Ring.name: Weapon Ring
Weapon Ring.flavor: With a flick of a finger, you produce a blade seemingly from thin air.
Weapon Ring.target: One nonliving object of 5 lb. or less that you are holding
Weapon Ring.effect: You change the target object into a small ring on one of your fingers, or change the ring back into the object. You can have only one such ring at a time. If the ring is removed from your finger, it returns to its original form.

Tiny Sunburst.name: Tiny Sunburst
Tiny Sunburst.flavor: You dazzle your foe with a bright burst of light.
Tiny Sunburst.trigger: A creature hits you with a melee or a ranged attack.
Tiny Sunburst.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the triggering creature takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you. If the creature has darkvision, the penalty instead applies to all the creature’s attack rolls.

Dimensional Confusion.name: Dimensional Confusion
Dimensional Confusion.flavor: Teleportation magic sends one of your foes into your place.
Dimensional Confusion.target: One creature of your size or smaller
Dimensional Confusion.effect: You and the target each teleport up to 5 squares, swapping positions. If the target is an enemy, it grants combat advantage until the end of your turn.

Endure Torment.name: Endure Torment
Endure Torment.flavor: You brace yourself for a particularly wicked blow, allowing you to shrug off pain for a time.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You take damage from an attack.

Effect: You reduce the damage of the triggering attack by 5 + your level. After the attack is resolved, you gain resist 5 to all damage until the start of your next turn.
Endure Torment.trigger: You take damage from an attack.
Endure Torment.effect: You reduce the damage of the triggering attack by 5 + your level. After the attack is resolved, you gain resist 5 to all damage until the start of your next turn.

Shift Blame.name: Shift Blame
Shift Blame.flavor: With quick reason and honeyed words, you turn your enemy’s attack against another target.
Shift Blame.trigger: You are hit by a melee or a ranged attack.
Shift Blame.effect: The attack instead targets one ally in the burst within range of the attack.

Betray Confidence.name: Betray Confidence
Betray Confidence.flavor: You leave an ally in harm’s way so that you can find an opening.
Betray Confidence.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the target gains vulnerable 2 all, and you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls.

Beg Lolth's Favor.name: Beg Lolth's Favor
Beg Lolth's Favor.flavor: You turn to the Spider Queen in a time of need, and she unexpectedly answers your prayer.
Beg Lolth's Favor.martialFavor: Until the end of your next turn, enemies in the burst grant combat advantage and take a -4 penalty to attack rolls.
Beg Lolth's Favor.healingFavor(Healing): You and one ally in the burst can spend a healing surge.
Beg Lolth's Favor.divineFavor: You and each ally in the burst gain a +4 power bonus to damage rolls until the end of your next turn.

Lurking Spider.name: Lurking Spider
Lurking Spider.flavor: Your unexpected counter knocks your foe off balance.
Lurking Spider.trigger: A creature within your reach hits you with an attack.
Lurking Spider.effect: The triggering creature is slowed until the end of its next turn, and you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Blade Spider's Lunge.name: Blade Spider's Lunge
Blade Spider's Lunge.flavor: Your deadly strikes leave your foes reeling.
Blade Spider's Lunge.effect: You assume the blade spider’s lunge stance. Until the stance ends, any creature you hit grants combat advantage to the next creature that attacks it before the end of your next turn.

Dance of the Phase Spider.name: Dance of the Phase Spider
Dance of the Phase Spider.flavor: You fight in constant motion, always on the move around a foe and rolling with blows.
Dance of the Phase Spider.effect: You assume the dance of the phase spider stance. Until the stance ends, when an adjacent enemy shifts, you can shift 1 square as an immediate reaction. In addition, whenever you are subjected to forced movement, you can shift up to 2 squares as a free action after the forced movement is resolved.

Black Widow's Bite.name: Black Widow's Bite
Black Widow's Bite.flavor: You strike a particular pressure point with a well-aimed blow, twisting your foe with agony
Black Widow's Bite.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack.
Black Widow's Bite.effect: That enemy is also immobilized and takes ongoing 10 damage (save ends both).

Blood Empowerment.name: Blood Empowerment
Blood Empowerment.flavor: Through sacrifice, you strengthen your magic.
Blood Empowerment.target: You or one willing, stunned, or helpless creature in the burst
Blood Empowerment.effect: The target takes damage equal to your level. You can roll twice and use the higher result on one attack roll you make this turn.

Demonic Ward.name: Demonic Ward
Demonic Ward.flavor: You call upon dark pacts you have made with demons to protect you from your foe’s elemental strikes.
Demonic Ward.trigger: You take acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage.
Demonic Ward.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain resistance to one of the triggering damage types equal to 5 + one-half your level.

Shiver Flesh.name: Shiver Flesh
Shiver Flesh.flavor: Your vile magic is anathema to living flesh.
Shiver Flesh.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier or Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and the target is dazed and takes ongoing 5 necrotic damage (save ends both).
Shiver Flesh.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).

Glasstrike.name: Glasstrike
Glasstrike.flavor: As your spell takes hold, your foe’s limbs freeze up and its body becomes a statue of black glass.
Glasstrike.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target is petrified and loses all resistance to damage (save ends both).

Sudden Slime.name: Sudden Slime
Sudden Slime.flavor: A sudden explosion of green slime covers your opponents in corrosive acid.
Sudden Slime.onHit: Your highest ability modifier acid damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Scouring Palm.name: Scouring Palm
Scouring Palm.flavor: Your hands become coated in a caustic acid that eats through whatever you touch.
Scouring Palm.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to Thievery checks and to Strength checks made to force open, break, or bend wood objects and metal objects.
Scouring Palm.sustainMinor: The bonus persists until the end of your next turn.

Celerity Jelly.name: Celerity Jelly
Celerity Jelly.flavor: You smear the nearby ground with a slick jelly that accelerates your party’s movements.
Celerity Jelly.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain for your enemies. When you or an ally starts his or her turn in the zone, that character can move from one square in the zone to another as a free action.

Pudding Sight.name: Pudding Sight
Pudding Sight.flavor: You gain the senses of a pudding and can detect the faintest vibrations of your enemy’s movements.
Pudding Sight.effect: You gain tremorsense 10 until the end of the encounter.

Apostate's Freedom.name: Apostate's Freedom
Apostate's Freedom.flavor: You break free of the bonds that hold you and move swiftly to punish your foe.
Apostate's Freedom.effect: Before the attack, you can make a saving throw against a single immobilizing effect on you that a save can end. You also shift up to 2 squares.
Apostate's Freedom.onHit:
1[W] + highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 2[W] + highest ability modifier damage.

Caught in a Lie.name: Caught in a Lie
Caught in a Lie.flavor: You make one final effort to deceive your enemy. If that fails, you prepare to make a run for it.
Caught in a Lie.trigger: You fail a Bluff check against an enemy.
Caught in a Lie.effect: You reroll the Bluff check and use the second result. If you still fail the check, you gain a +6 power bonus to the next initiative check you make within the next hour.

Bane of Lolth.name: Bane of Lolth
Bane of Lolth.flavor: When facing your greatest enemies, you become a relentless force of destruction on the battlefield.
Bane of Lolth.effect: You enter the bane of Lolth stance. Until the stance ends, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses, as well as a power bonus to damage rolls against drow and spiders equal to your highest ability modifier.

Dark Retreat.name: Dark Retreat
Dark Retreat.flavor: You glide nimbly across the battlefield, leaving a patch of inky blackness in your wake.
Dark Retreat.prerequisite: You must have the cloud of darkness power.
Dark Retreat.effect: You shift up to your speed. If your cloud of darkness power is not expended, you can use it at any point during this movement as a free action.

Skulker's Venom.name: Skulker's Venom
Skulker's Venom.flavor: Your tools drip with the dark malice of the Masked Lord.
Skulker's Venom.effect:
Until the end of your next turn, when you hit an enemy with a weapon attack and that enemy is granting combat advantage to you, the enemy takes 4 extra poison damage.
    Level 11: 8 poison damage.
    Level 21: 12 poison damage.

Grace of the Masked Lord.name: Grace of the Masked Lord
Grace of the Masked Lord.flavor: With the blessing of Vhaeraun, you and your allies carefully avoid traps that threaten your group.
Grace of the Masked Lord.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in the zone, you and each ally gain a +3 power bonus to all defenses against traps. In addition, each ally who starts his or her turn in the zone can make a saving throw against an effect caused by a trap that a save can end.
Grace of the Masked Lord.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Noxious Step.name: Noxious Step
Noxious Step.flavor: You step into the shadows and emerge elsewhere, wreathed in a toxic cloud.
Noxious Step.effect: You teleport up to 5 squares. Until the end of your next turn, you have partial concealment and an aura 1. When an enemy ends its turn in that aura, that enemy takes 5 poison damage.

Guise of the Faithful.name: Guise of the Faithful
Guise of the Faithful.flavor: You and your comrade assume the forms of Lolth’s faithful servants.
Guise of the Faithful.target: You and one Small or Medium ally in the burst
Guise of the Faithful.effect:
You transform the auditory, tactile, and visual qualities of the targets’ bodies and equipment. Each target assumes the appearance of a drow, and you can choose to provide a target with the appearance of a specific drow whom you have seen.
    The illusion lasts for 1 hour, or you can end it as a minor action. A creature can recognize a target’s form as illusory with an Insight check opposed by that target’s Bluff check. The Bluff check is made with a +5 power bonus.

Sensory Caress.name: Sensory Caress
Sensory Caress.flavor: In a moment of quiet reflection, you open yourself to another’s pain.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One ally

Effect: You transfer one effect that a save can end from the target to yourself. Until you succeed on a saving throw against that effect, you gain a +2 power bonus to saving throws.
Sensory Caress.effect: You transfer one effect that a save can end from the target to yourself. Until you succeed on a saving throw against that effect, you gain a +2 power bonus to saving throws.

Been There, Done That.name: Been There, Done That
Been There, Done That.flavor: You know the dark of how to deal with predictable sods.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.

Effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the triggering enemy’s attacks until the end of your next turn.
Been There, Done That.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.
Been There, Done That.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the triggering enemy’s attacks until the end of your next turn.

Breadth of Experience.name: Breadth of Experience
Breadth of Experience.flavor: Variety is the spice of ending someone’s life.
Breadth of Experience.effect: You assume the breadth of experience stance. Until the stance ends, you gain a +2 power bonus to the attack rolls of attack powers you have not yet used during this encounter.

Action Momentum.name: Action Momentum
Action Momentum.flavor: It’s tough to control the mind of a cutter who’s not controlled by his or her thoughts.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy hits your Will with an attack.

Effect: You make a saving throw to end one effect imposed by the triggering attack on you, provided the effect has a stated duration.
Action Momentum.trigger: An enemy hits your Will with an attack.
Action Momentum.effect: You make a saving throw to end one effect imposed by the triggering attack on you, provided the effect has a stated duration.

Action Trance.name: Action Trance
Action Trance.flavor: You have learned to place yourself in a state that relies on reflex alone.
Action Trance.requirement: You must have at least one action point remaining.
Action Trance.effect: You assume the action trance stance, which ends if you spend an action point. Until the stance ends, you gain a +1 power bonus to speed and saving throws.

Master of the Mind.name: Master of the Mind
Master of the Mind.flavor: You know that all things must pass, and any hindrance is temporary.
Master of the Mind.effect: You assume the master of the mind stance. Until the stance ends, you can make a saving throw at the start of your turn against one effect that a save can end. If you fail the saving throw, you can still make a saving throw against the effect at the end of your turn. Additionally, when you succeed on a saving throw, you gain 5 temporary hit points.

Babble.name: Babble
Babble.flavor: Geegle dooo bleagh owlbear ron grickle flick tarrasque meat!
Babble.target: One creature that can hear you
Babble.attack:
Highest ability modifier + 2 vs. Will
    Level 11: Highest ability modifier + 4 vs. Will
    Level 21: Highest ability modifier + 6 vs. Will
Babble.effect: The target cannot speak intelligibly or deliver any effect that relies on speech (save ends).

Hornung's Deflector.name: Hornung's Deflector
Hornung's Deflector.flavor: A hemisphere of elemental matter manifests around you, deflecting incoming missiles or making you a bigger target.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are hit by a ranged attack.

Effect: The attack instead hits a random creature (including yourself) within 3 squares of you.
Hornung's Deflector.trigger: You are hit by a ranged attack.
Hornung's Deflector.effect: The attack instead hits a random creature (including yourself) within 3 squares of you.

The Die Is Cast.name: The Die Is Cast
The Die Is Cast.flavor: Chaos reigns in every glance, strike, and pose. Those who ally themselves with randomness can change their reality.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You roll a d20 and dislike the result.

Effect: Add 1d10 to the roll, and then subtract 1d4 from the roll.
The Die Is Cast.trigger: You roll a d20 and dislike the result.
The Die Is Cast.effect: Add 1d10 to the roll, and then subtract 1d4 from the roll.

Battlefield Shuffle.name: Battlefield Shuffle
Battlefield Shuffle.flavor: Sometimes you just have to toss everything up and hope it works out for the best.
keywords:
Close burst 20

Trigger: You roll initiative and dislike the result.

Effect: You and each creature in the burst reroll initiative. You and your allies gain a +4 power bonus to the roll, and your enemies take a -4 penalty to it.
Battlefield Shuffle.trigger: You roll initiative and dislike the result.
Battlefield Shuffle.effect: You and each creature in the burst reroll initiative. You and your allies gain a +4 power bonus to the roll, and your enemies take a -4 penalty to it.

Grasping Limb.name: Grasping Limb
Grasping Limb.flavor: You lash out with your malformed arm to grab a foe.
Grasping Limb.requirement: You must have a hand free.
Grasping Limb.attack:
Highest ability modifier + 2 vs. Reflex
    Level 11: Highest ability modifier + 4 vs. Reflex
    Level 21: Highest ability modifier + 6 vs. Reflex
Grasping Limb.onHit:
2d8 + your highest ability modifier damage, and you pull the target 1 square and grab it until the end of your next turn.
    Level 21: 3d8 + highest ability modifier damage.
Grasping Limb.sustainStandard:
The grab persists until the end of your next turn, and the grabbed target takes 2d8 + your highest ability modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3d8 + highest ability modifier damage.
Grasping Limb.special: When making an opportunity attack, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Shadow Sight.name: Shadow Sight
Shadow Sight.flavor: Your eyes flare brightly, enabling you to see into even the deepest shadows for a time.
Shadow Sight.onMiss: Until the end of your next turn, you gain darkvision and ignore any concealment.

Dread Carapace.name: Dread Carapace
Dread Carapace.flavor: A thick shell surrounds your form, frightening your enemies away.
Dread Carapace.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Fortitude. In addition, when any enemy ends its turn adjacent to you, it must use a free action to move up to its speed away from you.

Altered Extremity.name: Altered Extremity
Altered Extremity.flavor: Capitalizing on your malformed limb, you can extend your cursed appendage to an unnatural degree.
Altered Extremity.effect: Until the end of your next turn, your reach increases by 1, and you gain a +2 power bonus to melee damage rolls.

Blade of Nightmares.name: Blade of Nightmares
Blade of Nightmares.flavor: As your weapon becomes wreathed in dark energy, you strike a distracted opponent, which freezes in terror.
Blade of Nightmares.trigger: You hit an enemy with an opportunity attack.
Blade of Nightmares.effect: The enemy is immobilized until the end of its next turn.

Blade of Dark Whispers.name: Blade of Dark Whispers
Blade of Dark Whispers.flavor: Your foes tremble before the menacing whispers of your fearsome blade.
Blade of Dark Whispers.onHit: 1[W] + highest ability modifier damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to Will until the end of your next turn.

Blade of Black Wind.name: Blade of Black Wind
Blade of Black Wind.flavor: Dark winds howl around your weapon, and each time you strike an enemy, that foe recoils in terror.
Blade of Black Wind.effect: You assume the blade of black wind stance. Until the stance ends, any creature you hit with a melee weapon attack grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn. In addition, when you hit an enemy with a melee weapon attack, you can push that enemy 1 square.

Blade of Flickering Shadows.name: Blade of Flickering Shadows
Blade of Flickering Shadows.flavor: Encased in writhing shadows, your form begins to flicker, and your weapon ripples with ebon energy
Blade of Flickering Shadows.effect: You assume the blade of flickering shadows stance. Until the stance ends, you are phasing, have resist 10 necrotic, and can change any untyped damage you deal with weapon attacks to necrotic damage.

Beguiling Flash.name: Beguiling Flash
Beguiling Flash.flavor: You create a sudden flash of light that temporarily confuses your foe so that it cannot easily find you.
Beguiling Flash.onHit: You slide the target up to 3 squares. Until the end of your next turn, you have partial concealment from the target.

Cloaking Feint.name: Cloaking Feint
Cloaking Feint.flavor: With a quick flourish, you convince an opponent that you aren’t really where it thinks you are.
Cloaking Feint.effect: Make an Arcana check. If the check result beats the target’s passive Insight, you gain combat advantage and partial concealment against the target until the end of your next turn.

Trickster Veil.name: Trickster Veil
Trickster Veil.flavor: With a nearly perfect disguise, no one can see your true face—or the dagger hidden in your boot.
Trickster Veil.effect: For the next hour, whenever you make a Bluff or Thievery check, you can roll twice and use the higher result.

Vanishing Swirl.name: Vanishing Swirl
Vanishing Swirl.flavor: As your enemy draws near, you spin away and disappear into thin air.
Vanishing Swirl.trigger: An enemy moves adjacent to you.
Vanishing Swirl.effect: You become invisible until the start of your next turn, and you shift up to 2 squares.

Sign of the Golden Ram.name: Sign of the Golden Ram
Sign of the Golden Ram.flavor: You draw a sigil on the ground that repels your enemies.
Sign of the Golden Ram.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Until the effect ends, you can use the secondary power at will.
Sign of the Golden Ram.requirement: The Sign of the Golden Ram power must be active in order to use this power.
Sign of the Golden Ram.trigger: An enemy enters the zone or starts its turn there.
Sign of the Golden Ram.onHit: Highest ability modifier damage, and you push the target up to 3 squares from the zone’s origin square.

Twisting Fortune.name: Twisting Fortune
Twisting Fortune.flavor: Your foreknowledge allows you to expend personal energy to change the odds in your favor.
Twisting Fortune.effect: Until the end of your next turn, whenever you make an attack roll, check, or saving throw, you can spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. Instead, you reroll the attack roll, check, or saving throw three times, taking the highest result.

Fiendish Oracle.name: Fiendish Oracle
Fiendish Oracle.flavor: You draw a diagram on the ground and call on a minor fiend to assist you.
Fiendish Oracle.requirement: You must use this power during an extended rest or a short rest.
Fiendish Oracle.effect:
You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. Instead, you call forth the awareness of a fiend and ask up to three questions of it. For each question, make a check with a bonus of 5 + one-half your level + your highest ability modifier against a DC the DM secretly sets.
    On a successful check, the fiend gives a truthful answer. If the check fails, or the DM decides the fiend cannot know the information, the answer is a lie.
    You also gain a +2 power bonus to all knowledge checks until you reach the next milestone or take an extended rest.

Circle of Antipathy.name: Circle of Antipathy
Circle of Antipathy.flavor: Your hastily inscribed hermetic circle flares, creating a barrier to hedge out your enemies.
Circle of Antipathy.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in the zone, you and your allies gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses against attacks that originate outside the zone. Moving into a square in the zone costs an enemy 4 extra squares of movement.
Circle of Antipathy.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Inquisitive Shadowing.name: Inquisitive Shadowing
Inquisitive Shadowing.flavor: You can follow your target right up to its doorstep without it ever noticing you.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a Perception or Stealth check opposed by another creature and dislike the result.

Effect: Reroll the Perception or Stealth check and use either result.
Inquisitive Shadowing.trigger: You make a Perception or Stealth check opposed by another creature and dislike the result.
Inquisitive Shadowing.effect: Reroll the Perception or Stealth check and use either result.

Inquisitive Intuition.name: Inquisitive Intuition
Inquisitive Intuition.flavor: You turn over each piece of information in your head before a flash of insight lets you see the bigger picture.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make an Insight, Perception, Streetwise, or knowledge check and dislike the result.

Effect: Resolve the check as if you had rolled a 20.
Inquisitive Intuition.trigger: You make an Insight, Perception, Streetwise, or knowledge check and dislike the result.
Inquisitive Intuition.effect: Resolve the check as if you had rolled a 20.

Inquisitive Awareness.name: Inquisitive Awareness
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, or until you take damage or make an attack, you gain blindsight 1 and a +5 power bonus to Perception, Insight, and knowledge checks related to anything you can sense within 10 squares of you.
Inquisitive Awareness.effect: Until the end of the encounter, or until you take damage or make an attack, you gain  blindsight 1 and a +5 power bonus to Perception, Insight, and knowledge checks related to anything you can sense within 10 squares of you.

Courtier's Cover.name: Courtier's Cover
Courtier's Cover.flavor: You quickly cover for another’s gaffe.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: While you are able to speak, an ally that you can hear and is within 5 squares of you makes a Diplomacy check and dislikes the result.

Effect: Make a Diplomacy check and use your result in place of the triggering result.
Courtier's Cover.trigger: While you are able to speak, an ally that you can hear and is within 5 squares of you makes a  Diplomacy check and dislikes the result.
Courtier's Cover.effect: Make a Diplomacy check and use your result in place of the triggering result.

Call for Capitulation.name: Call for Capitulation
Call for Capitulation.flavor: Your words reveal the wisdom of surrender.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make an Intimidate check to force an opponent to surrender

Effect: In place of the Intimidate check, make a Diplomacy check with a DC equal to the target’s Will defense + 5.
Call for Capitulation.trigger: You would make an Intimidate check to force an opponent to surrender
Call for Capitulation.effect: In place of the Intimidate check, make a Diplomacy check with a DC equal to the target’s Will defense + 5.

Bastion of Words.name: Bastion of Words
Bastion of Words.flavor: A well-timed warning causes your enemies to hesitate.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Target: Each enemy who can hear and understand you in the burst.

Effect: Make a Diplomacy check against each target’s passive Insight. If the check succeeds against a target, the target cannot take actions during your turn until the end of your next turn.
Bastion of Words.target: Each enemy who can hear and understand you in the burst.
Bastion of Words.effect: Make a Diplomacy check against each target’s passive Insight. If the check succeeds against a target, the target cannot take actions during your turn until the end of your next turn.

Skulking Spy.name: Skulking Spy
Skulking Spy.flavor: You move quickly to escape the notice of your foes.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Shift up to your speed. If you have any cover or concealment at the end of this movement, you can make a Stealth check to become hidden.
Skulking Spy.effect: Shift up to your speed. If you have any cover or concealment at the end of this movement, you can make a Stealth check to become hidden.

Spy's Recovery.name: Spy's Recovery
Spy's Recovery.flavor: Your fast thinking turns a mistake into an opportunity.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a Bluff, Insight, Perception, or Stealth check and dislike the result.

Effect: Reroll the triggering check and use either result.
Spy's Recovery.trigger: You make a Bluff, Insight, Perception, or Stealth check and dislike the result.
Spy's Recovery.effect: Reroll the triggering check and use either result.

Sow Confusion.name: Sow Confusion
Sow Confusion.flavor: By drawing attention to another, you can slip away.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: At least two creatures must be within 1 square of you and be able to see and hear you.

Effect: Make a Bluff check to create a diversion to hide. If you succeed against one creature within 1 square of you, you succeed against all creatures within 1 square of you. In addition, if you use your skulking spy power on the same turn after using this power, that use of skulking spy allows you to shift through enemy spaces.
Sow Confusion.requirement: At least two creatures must be within 1 square of you and be able to see and hear you.
Sow Confusion.effect: Make a Bluff check to create a diversion to hide. If you succeed against one creature within 1 square of you, you succeed against all creatures within 1 square of you. In addition, if you use your skulking spy power on the same turn after using this power, that use of skulking spy allows you to shift through enemy spaces.

Spy's Focus.name: Spy's Focus
Spy's Focus.flavor: You memorize your surroundings for later recall.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever you make an Insight check or a Perception check, you can roll twice and take the higher result. You can later perfectly recall anything that you sense while this effect persists, such as a skimmed document or the exact wording of a conversation you overheard.
Spy's Focus.effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever you make an Insight check or a Perception check, you can roll twice and take the higher result. You can later perfectly recall anything that you sense while this effect persists, such as a skimmed document or the exact wording of a conversation you overheard.

Mark of the Vigilante.name: Mark of the Vigilante
Mark of the Vigilante.flavor: Your signature fighting style unnerves your foes.
Mark of the Vigilante.effect:
You assume a stance, the mark of the vigilante. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
         Whenever you hit an enemy with a melee or ranged attack, you can mark the enemy until the end of your next turn.
         You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against opportunity attacks that you provoke by moving.

Vigilante Grit.name: Vigilante Grit
Vigilante Grit.flavor: You draw upon your inner drive to shake off a debilitating effect.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Make a saving throw against one effect that a save can end.
Vigilante Grit.effect: Make a saving throw against one effect that a save can end.

Dramatic Entrance.name: Dramatic Entrance
Dramatic Entrance.flavor: You flamboyantly rush into combat, dazzling your foes.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You roll initiative.

Effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to your initiative check. Additionally, you gain a +2 power bonus to speed and to attack rolls until the end of the encounter or an enemy acts in the encounter. Until the end of the encounter or until an enemy hits you with an attack, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses.
Dramatic Entrance.effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to your initiative check. Additionally, you gain a +2 power bonus to speed and to attack rolls until the end of the encounter or an enemy acts in the encounter. Until the end of the encounter or until an enemy hits you with an attack, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses.

Roof-Runner Stance.name: Roof-Runner Stance
Roof-Runner Stance.flavor: You move gracefully over and past obstacles that impede your foes.
Roof-Runner Stance.effect: You assume the roof-runner stance. Until the stance ends, you ignore difficult terrain. Additionally, you can climb, balance, and squeeze at full speed rather than at half speed.

Guidance of the Past.name: Guidance of the Past
Guidance of the Past.flavor: Your spiritual connection to the past sometimes provides you with unusual and shocking insights.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make an attack roll, a skill check, or an ability check.

Effect: You roll two d20s for the triggering roll, and use either result. If you roll the same number on both dice, after you complete the action related to the triggering roll, you are dazed until the end of your next turn.
Guidance of the Past.trigger: You make an attack roll, a skill check, or an ability check.
Guidance of the Past.effect: You roll two d20s for the triggering roll, and use either result. If you roll the same number on both dice, after you complete the action related to the triggering roll, you are dazed until the end of your next turn.

Mythical Recall.name: Mythical Recall
Mythical Recall.flavor: You recall the successful efforts your people made to tame the world in which they lived.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Choose a beast, humanoid, or magical beast that you can see and make a monster knowledge check, using History in place of the skill you would normally use. If the result is 20 or higher, you gain combat advantage against the creature until the end of your next turn.
Mythical Recall.effect: Choose a beast, humanoid, or magical beast that you can see and make a monster knowledge check, using History in place of the skill you would normally use. If the result is 20 or higher, you gain combat advantage against the creature until the end of your next turn.

Profound Flashback.name: Profound Flashback
Profound Flashback.flavor: Your mind momentarily drifts through time, back to your old life, and reveals the solution you need.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make an attack roll, a skill check, or an ability check, and you dislike the result.

Effect: Reroll three d20s for the triggering roll, and use any result. If you roll the same number on any two dice, after you complete the action related to the triggering roll, you are dazed until the end of your next turn.
Profound Flashback.trigger: You make an attack roll, a skill check, or an ability check, and you dislike the result.
Profound Flashback.effect: Reroll three d20s for the triggering roll, and use any result. If you roll the same number on any two dice, after you complete the action related to the triggering roll, you are dazed until the end of your next turn.

Time Jaunt.name: Time Jaunt
Time Jaunt.flavor: The world wavers as you return to your proper time for a moment, which you bring back with you.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You are removed from play for the next two turns and reappear at the start of the third. When you return, you can spend a healing surge and you gain an action point. You return to play in an unoccupied space within 5 squares of the last space you occupied.
Time Jaunt.effect: You are removed from play for the next two turns and reappear at the start of the third. When you return, you can spend a healing surge and you gain an action point. You return to play in an unoccupied space within 5 squares of the last space you occupied.

River Rat's Gambit.name: River Rat's Gambit
River Rat's Gambit.flavor: You retaliate ferociously when wounded, risking your own skin in the process.
keywords: Level 11: 3d6 extra damage; 2d6 damage if you miss.
River Rat's Gambit.effect:
You use an at-will attack power against the target. If you hit, you deal the target 2d6 extra damage. If you miss, you take 1d6 damage.
    Level 11: 3d6 extra damage; 2d6 damage if you miss.
    Level 21: 4d6 extra damage; 3d6 damage if you miss.

River Rat Tactics.name: River Rat Tactics
River Rat Tactics.flavor: When it counts, you know how to take advantage of any opening you find.
River Rat Tactics.effect: You assume the river rat tactics stance. Until the stance ends, you have combat advantage  against any enemy that is adjacent to one or more of your allies.

River Rat Quack.name: River Rat Quack
River Rat Quack.flavor: Because of your shifting body language and fast talk, your foe has difficulty reacting to your actions.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Target: One creature that can see and hear you in the burst

Effect: Make a Bluff check to gain combat advantage against the target. If you succeed, you also provoke no opportunity attacks from the target until the end of your next turn.
River Rat Quack.target: One creature that can see and hear you in the burst
River Rat Quack.effect: Make a Bluff check to gain combat advantage against the target. If you succeed, you also  provoke no opportunity attacks from the target until the end of your next turn.

River Rat Cheek.name: River Rat Cheek
River Rat Cheek.flavor: When the odds look bleak, you smile and double down on your trash talk.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are bloodied by an attack.

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +1 power bonus to all defenses and a +1 power bonus to saving throws. Whenever an attack misses you or you succeed on a saving throw, you gain temporary hit points equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier.
River Rat Cheek.trigger: You are bloodied by an attack.
River Rat Cheek.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +1 power bonus to all defenses and a +1 power  bonus to saving throws. Whenever an attack misses you or you succeed on a saving throw, you gain temporary hit points equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier.
